translations.chinese: 高祖，沛豐邑中陽裏人，姓劉氏，字季。
translations.literal: Gao Zu was from Zhongyangli in Feng township, Pei, with the surname Liu and given name Ji.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Gaozu was born in Zhongyang Village, Feng Township, Pei County. His surname was Liu, and his given name was Ji.

context.next: 父曰太公，母曰劉媼。

translations.chinese: 父曰太公，母曰劉媼。
translations.literal: His father was called the Grand Duke; his mother was called Dame Liu.
translations.idiomatic: His father was known as the Grand Duke, and his mother as Dame Liu.

context.previous: 高祖，沛豐邑中陽裏人，姓劉氏，字季。
context.next: 其先劉媼嘗息大澤之陂，夢與神遇。

translations.chinese: 其先劉媼嘗息大澤之陂，夢與神遇。
translations.literal: Previously his mother Dame Liu was resting by the embankment of a great marsh and dreamed she encountered a spirit.
translations.idiomatic: Earlier, his mother Dame Liu had been resting by the dike of a great marsh when she dreamed she encountered a spirit.

context.previous: 父曰太公，母曰劉媼。
context.next: 是時雷電晦冥，太公往視，則見蛟龍於其上。

translations.chinese: 是時雷電晦冥，太公往視，則見蛟龍於其上。
translations.literal: At that time there was thunder and lightning with darkness; the Grand Duke went to look and saw a scaly dragon above her.
translations.idiomatic: At that moment, thunder crashed and lightning flashed in the darkness. The Grand Duke went to check and saw a horned dragon hovering above her.

context.previous: 其先劉媼嘗息大澤之陂，夢與神遇。
context.next: 已而有身，遂產高祖。

translations.chinese: 已而有身，遂產高祖。
translations.literal: Soon after she became pregnant and gave birth to Gao Zu.
translations.idiomatic: Soon after, she became pregnant and gave birth to Emperor Gaozu.

context.previous: 是時雷電晦冥，太公往視，則見蛟龍於其上。

translations.chinese: 高祖為人，隆準而龍顏，美須髯，左股有七十二黑子。
translations.literal: Gao Zu as a person had a high-bridged nose and dragon-like countenance, fine whiskers and beard, and seventy-two black moles on his left thigh.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Gaozu had a high-bridged nose and dragon-like features, with fine whiskers and beard. On his left thigh were seventy-two black moles.

context.next: 仁而愛人，喜施，意豁如也。

translations.chinese: 仁而愛人，喜施，意豁如也。
translations.literal: He was benevolent and loved people, delighted in giving, and his spirit was open and expansive.
translations.idiomatic: He was benevolent and loved people, took delight in generosity, and had an open, expansive spirit.

context.previous: 高祖為人，隆準而龍顏，美須髯，左股有七十二黑子。
context.next: 常有大度，不事家人生產作業。

translations.chinese: 常有大度，不事家人生產作業。
translations.literal: He always had a generous nature and did not attend to his family's productive work.
translations.idiomatic: He always had a generous disposition and paid no attention to his family's farming and labor.

context.previous: 仁而愛人，喜施，意豁如也。
context.next: 及壯，試為吏，為泗水亭長，廷中吏無所不狎侮，好酒及色。

translations.chinese: 及壯，試為吏，為泗水亭長，廷中吏無所不狎侮，好酒及色。
translations.literal: When he grew up, he tested for official service and became Pavilion Head of Sishui; among the clerks of the court there was none he did not treat familiarly or make sport of; he loved wine and women.
translations.idiomatic: When he came of age, he took the civil service exam and became Pavilion Chief of Sishui County. Among the court clerks, there was none he didn't treat familiarly or tease. He loved wine and women.

context.previous: 常有大度，不事家人生產作業。
context.next: 常從王媼、武負貰酒，醉臥，武負、王媼見其上常有龍，怪之。

translations.chinese: 常從王媼、武負貰酒，醉臥，武負、王媼見其上常有龍，怪之。
translations.literal: He often bought wine on credit from Dame Wang and Wu Fu; when drunk and lying down, Wu Fu and Dame Wang saw that above him there was always a dragon—they found this strange.
translations.idiomatic: He often bought wine on credit from Dame Wang and Wu Fu. When drunk and lying down, Wu Fu and Dame Wang saw a dragon always hovering above him—they found this very strange.

context.previous: 及壯，試為吏，為泗水亭長，廷中吏無所不狎侮，好酒及色。
context.next: 高祖每酤留飲，酒讎數倍。

translations.chinese: 高祖每酤留飲，酒讎數倍。
translations.literal: Whenever Gao Zu bought and lingered drinking, the wine debt would be multiplied several times.
translations.idiomatic: Whenever Emperor Gaozu bought wine and lingered drinking, his tab would multiply several times over.

context.previous: 常從王媼、武負貰酒，醉臥，武負、王媼見其上常有龍，怪之。
context.next: 及見怪，歲竟，此兩家常折券棄責。

translations.chinese: 及見怪，歲竟，此兩家常折券棄責。
translations.literal: When they saw these strange signs, at year's end these two households would always tear up the debt markers and forgive the debt.
translations.idiomatic: But when they saw these strange signs, at year's end both households would tear up the IOUs and forgive his debts.

context.previous: 高祖每酤留飲，酒讎數倍。

translations.chinese: 高祖常繇咸陽，縱觀，觀秦皇帝，喟然太息曰：「嗟乎，大丈夫當如此也！」
translations.literal: Gao Zu once went on corvée duty to Xianyang and took the opportunity to observe; seeing the Emperor of Qin, he sighed deeply and said: "Ah, a great man should be like this!"
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Gaozu once went on corvée labor to Xianyang and took the chance to observe the sights. When he saw the Emperor of Qin, he sighed deeply and said: 'Ah, a true man should be like this!'

translations.chinese: 單父人呂公善沛令，避仇從之客，因家沛焉。
translations.literal: Lü Gong of Shanfu was on good terms with the Pei magistrate; fleeing from a vendetta he came to lodge with him and consequently made his home in Pei.
translations.idiomatic: Lü Gong of Shanfu was on good terms with the Pei county magistrate. Fleeing a feud, he came to stay with him and eventually settled in Pei.

context.next: 沛中豪桀吏聞令有重客，皆往賀。

translations.chinese: 沛中豪桀吏聞令有重客，皆往賀。
translations.literal: The heroic gentlemen and officials of Pei heard that the magistrate had an important guest and all went to offer congratulations.
translations.idiomatic: The local worthies and officials of Pei heard the magistrate had an important guest and all came to offer congratulations.

context.previous: 單父人呂公善沛令，避仇從之客，因家沛焉。
context.next: 蕭何為主吏，主進，令諸大夫曰：「進不滿千錢，坐之堂下。」

translations.chinese: 蕭何為主吏，主進，令諸大夫曰：「進不滿千錢，坐之堂下。」
translations.literal: Xiao He was the supervising clerk in charge of reception; he issued orders to all the gentlemen saying: "Those whose gifts are less than a thousand cash shall sit in the lower hall."
translations.idiomatic: Xiao He, as chief clerk overseeing the reception, issued orders to all the gentlemen: 'Those whose congratulatory gifts are less than a thousand cash shall sit in the lower hall.'

context.previous: 沛中豪桀吏聞令有重客，皆往賀。
context.next: 高祖為亭長，素易諸吏，乃紿為謁曰「賀錢萬」，實不持一錢。

translations.chinese: 高祖為亭長，素易諸吏，乃紿為謁曰「賀錢萬」，實不持一錢。
translations.literal: Gao Zu as Pavilion Head had always treated the officials casually, so he falsely wrote on his visiting card 'Gift of ten thousand cash,' though he actually carried not a single coin.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Gaozu, as pavilion chief, had always treated officials casually. So he boldly wrote on his calling card 'Congratulatory gift: ten thousand cash,' though he actually brought not a single coin.

context.previous: 蕭何為主吏，主進，令諸大夫曰：「進不滿千錢，坐之堂下。」
context.next: 謁入，呂公大驚，起，迎之門。

translations.chinese: 謁入，呂公大驚，起，迎之門。
translations.literal: When the card was sent in, Lü Gong was greatly surprised, rose, and welcomed him at the gate.
translations.idiomatic: When the calling card was presented, Lü Gong was greatly astonished. He rose and went out to welcome him at the gate.

context.previous: 高祖為亭長，素易諸吏，乃紿為謁曰「賀錢萬」，實不持一錢。
context.next: 呂公者，好相人，見高祖狀貌，因重敬之，引入坐。

translations.chinese: 呂公者，好相人，見高祖狀貌，因重敬之，引入坐。
translations.literal: Lü Gong liked reading people's physiognomy; seeing Gao Zu's appearance, he consequently held him in high regard, invited him in, and seated him.
translations.idiomatic: Lü Gong was fond of reading physiognomy. Seeing Emperor Gaozu's features, he came to hold him in great respect, invited him inside, and seated him.

context.previous: 謁入，呂公大驚，起，迎之門。
context.next: 蕭何曰：「劉季固多大言，少成事。」

translations.chinese: 蕭何曰：「劉季固多大言，少成事。」
translations.literal: Xiao He said: "Liu Ji is always full of grand talk but accomplishes little."
translations.idiomatic: Xiao He said: 'Liu Ji is certainly full of big talk but accomplishes little.'

context.previous: 呂公者，好相人，見高祖狀貌，因重敬之，引入坐。
context.next: 高祖因狎侮諸客，遂坐上坐，無所詘。

translations.chinese: 高祖因狎侮諸客，遂坐上坐，無所詘。
translations.literal: Gao Zu then treated the guests familiarly and sat in the seat of honor without any humility.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Gaozu then treated all the guests familiarly and took the seat of honor without any deference.

context.previous: 蕭何曰：「劉季固多大言，少成事。」
context.next: 酒闌，呂公因目固留高祖。

translations.chinese: 酒闌，呂公因目固留高祖。
translations.literal: As the banquet ended, Lü Gong signaled with his eyes to firmly detain Gaozu.
translations.idiomatic: As the banquet drew to a close, Lü Gong signaled with his eyes to keep Gaozu there.

context.previous: 高祖因狎侮諸客，遂坐上坐，無所詘。
context.next: 高祖竟酒，後。

translations.chinese: 高祖竟酒，後。
translations.literal: Gao Zu finished the wine and remained after.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Gaozu finished his wine and stayed behind after the others left.

context.previous: 酒闌，呂公因目固留高祖。
context.next: 呂公曰：「臣少好相人，相人多矣，無如季相，願季自愛。

translations.chinese: 呂公曰：「臣少好相人，相人多矣，無如季相，願季自愛。
translations.literal: Lü Gong said: "I have long liked reading physiognomy and have read many people, but none compare to Ji's; I hope Ji will take care of himself.
translations.idiomatic: Lü Gong said: 'I have long enjoyed reading physiognomy and have read many people, but none can compare to Ji's features. I hope Ji will take good care of himself.'

context.previous: 高祖竟酒，後。
context.next: 臣有息女，願為季箕帚妾。」

translations.chinese: 臣有息女，願為季箕帚妾。」
translations.literal: I have a daughter and wish her to be Ji's humble wife."
translations.idiomatic: I have a daughter and wish her to be Ji's humble wife.''

context.previous: 呂公曰：「臣少好相人，相人多矣，無如季相，願季自愛。
context.next: 酒罷，呂媼怒呂公曰：「公始常欲奇此女，與貴人。

translations.chinese: 酒罷，呂媼怒呂公曰：「公始常欲奇此女，與貴人。
translations.literal: When the wine ended, Dame Lü was angry at Lü Gong, saying: "You always wanted to treat this daughter as exceptional and give her to a noble person.
translations.idiomatic: After the banquet ended, Dame Lü angrily rebuked Lü Gong: 'You always wanted to treat this daughter as special and marry her to a nobleman.'

context.previous: 臣有息女，願為季箕帚妾。」
context.next: 沛令善公，求之不與，何自妄許與劉季？」

translations.chinese: 沛令善公，求之不與，何自妄許與劉季？」
translations.literal: The Pei magistrate is on good terms with you and sought her but you did not give her—why do you rashly promise her to Liu Ji?"
translations.idiomatic: The Pei county magistrate is on good terms with you and asked for her, but you refused. Why do you rashly promise her to Liu Ji?''

context.previous: 酒罷，呂媼怒呂公曰：「公始常欲奇此女，與貴人。
context.next: 呂公曰：「此非兒女子所知也。」

translations.chinese: 呂公曰：「此非兒女子所知也。」
translations.literal: Lü Gong said: "This is not something children and women can understand."
translations.idiomatic: Lü Gong said: 'This is not something for children and women to understand.''

context.previous: 沛令善公，求之不與，何自妄許與劉季？」
context.next: 卒與劉季。

translations.chinese: 卒與劉季。
translations.literal: He finally gave her to Liu Ji.
translations.idiomatic: In the end, he gave her to Liu Ji.

context.previous: 呂公曰：「此非兒女子所知也。」
context.next: 呂公女乃呂后也，生孝惠帝、魯元公主。

translations.chinese: 呂公女乃呂后也，生孝惠帝、魯元公主。
translations.literal: Lü Gong's daughter was Empress Lü; she gave birth to Emperor Xiaohui and Princess Lu Yuan.
translations.idiomatic: Lü Gong's daughter became Empress Lü. She gave birth to Emperor Xiaohui and Princess Lu Yuan.

context.previous: 卒與劉季。

translations.chinese: 高祖為亭長時，常告歸之田。
translations.literal: When Gao Zu was Pavilion Head, he would often request leave to return to his fields.
translations.idiomatic: When Emperor Gaozu was pavilion chief, he would often request leave to return to his farm.

context.next: 呂后與兩子居田中耨，有一老父過請飲，呂后因餔之。

translations.chinese: 呂后與兩子居田中耨，有一老父過請飲，呂后因餔之。
translations.literal: Empress Lü with her two children were in the fields weeding when an old man passed by and requested a drink; Empress Lü consequently fed him.
translations.idiomatic: Empress Lü was in the fields weeding with her two children when an old man passed by and asked for a drink. Empress Lü fed him.

context.previous: 高祖為亭長時，常告歸之田。
context.next: 老父相呂后曰：「夫人天下貴人。」

translations.chinese: 老父相呂后曰：「夫人天下貴人。」
translations.literal: The old man read Empress Lü's physiognomy and said: "Madam will be the most noble person under Heaven."
translations.idiomatic: The old man read Empress Lü's physiognomy and said: 'Madam will be the most noble person in the world.''

context.previous: 呂后與兩子居田中耨，有一老父過請飲，呂后因餔之。
context.next: 令相兩子，見孝惠，曰：「夫人所以貴者，乃此男也。」

translations.chinese: 令相兩子，見孝惠，曰：「夫人所以貴者，乃此男也。」
translations.literal: He asked to read the two children's physiognomy; seeing Xiaohui, he said: "The reason Madam will be noble is because of this boy."
translations.idiomatic: He asked to read the physiognomy of both children. Looking at Xiaohui, he said: 'The reason Madam will be noble is this boy.''

context.previous: 老父相呂后曰：「夫人天下貴人。」
context.next: 相魯元，亦皆貴。

translations.chinese: 相魯元，亦皆貴。
translations.literal: Reading Lu Yuan's physiognomy, she would also be noble.
translations.idiomatic: Reading Lu Yuan's physiognomy, he said she would also be noble.

context.previous: 令相兩子，見孝惠，曰：「夫人所以貴者，乃此男也。」
context.next: 老父已去，高祖適從旁舍來，呂后具言客有過，相我子母皆大貴。

translations.chinese: 老父已去，高祖適從旁舍來，呂后具言客有過，相我子母皆大貴。
translations.literal: After the old man left, Gao Zu happened to come from a neighboring house; Empress Lü fully told him that a guest had passed by and read the physiognomy of her and the children, all predicting great nobility.
translations.idiomatic: After the old man left, Emperor Gaozu happened to come from a neighboring house. Empress Lü told him in detail that a guest had passed by and read the physiognomy of her and the children, predicting great nobility for all of them.

context.previous: 相魯元，亦皆貴。
context.next: 高祖問，曰：「未遠。」

translations.chinese: 高祖問，曰：「未遠。」
translations.literal: Gao Zu asked where he was; she said: "Not far."
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Gaozu asked where he was. She said: 'Not far.''

context.previous: 老父已去，高祖適從旁舍來，呂后具言客有過，相我子母皆大貴。
context.next: 乃追及，問老父。

translations.chinese: 乃追及，問老父。
translations.literal: He then pursued and caught up with the old man and questioned him.
translations.idiomatic: He then pursued and caught up with the old man, questioning him.

context.previous: 高祖問，曰：「未遠。」
context.next: 老父曰：「鄉者夫人嬰兒皆似君，君相貴不可言。」

translations.chinese: 老父曰：「鄉者夫人嬰兒皆似君，君相貴不可言。」
translations.literal: The old man said: "Earlier your wife and children all resemble you; your physiognomy indicates nobility beyond description."
translations.idiomatic: The old man said: 'Earlier your wife and children all resemble you. Your physiognomy indicates nobility beyond description.''

context.previous: 乃追及，問老父。
context.next: 高祖乃謝曰：「誠如父言，不敢忘德。」

translations.chinese: 高祖乃謝曰：「誠如父言，不敢忘德。」
translations.literal: Gao Zu then bowed and said: "If it is truly as you say, I dare not forget this kindness."
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Gaozu then bowed and said: 'If it is truly as you say, I dare not forget this kindness.''

context.previous: 老父曰：「鄉者夫人嬰兒皆似君，君相貴不可言。」
context.next: 及高祖貴，遂不知老父處。

translations.chinese: 及高祖貴，遂不知老父處。
translations.literal: When Gao Zu became noble, they never found where the old man was.
translations.idiomatic: When Emperor Gaozu became noble, they could never find where the old man was.

context.previous: 高祖乃謝曰：「誠如父言，不敢忘德。」

translations.chinese: 高祖為亭長，乃以竹皮為冠，令求盜之薛治之，時時冠之，及貴常冠，所謂「劉氏冠」乃是也。
translations.literal: When Gao Zu was Pavilion Head, he made a cap of bamboo bark and had the cap-maker of Xue craft it; he wore it from time to time, and when he became noble he always wore it—the so-called 'Liu cap' is this.
translations.idiomatic: When Emperor Gaozu was pavilion chief, he made a hat from bamboo bark and had the hat-maker of Xue craft it. He wore it from time to time, and when he became noble he always wore it. This is the so-called 'Liu hat.''

translations.chinese: 高祖以亭長為縣送徒酈山，徒多道亡。
translations.literal: As Pavilion Head, Gao Zu escorted convicts for the county to Mount Li; many escaped on the road.
translations.idiomatic: As pavilion chief, Emperor Gaozu escorted convicts for the county to Mount Li. Many escaped along the way.

context.next: 自度比至皆亡之，到豐西澤中，止飲，夜乃解縱所送徒。

translations.chinese: 自度比至皆亡之，到豐西澤中，止飲，夜乃解縱所送徒。
translations.literal: He estimated that by the time they arrived all would have fled, so reaching the marshes west of Feng, he stopped to drink, and at night released all the convicts he was escorting.
translations.idiomatic: He estimated that by the time they arrived, all would have fled. Reaching the marshes west of Feng, he stopped to drink, and at night released all the convicts he was escorting.

context.previous: 高祖以亭長為縣送徒酈山，徒多道亡。
context.next: 曰：「公等皆去，吾亦從此逝矣！」

translations.chinese: 曰：「公等皆去，吾亦從此逝矣！」
translations.literal: He said: "You may all go; I too will depart from here!"
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'You may all go. I too will depart from here!''

context.previous: 自度比至皆亡之，到豐西澤中，止飲，夜乃解縱所送徒。
context.next: 徒中壯士願從者十餘人。

translations.chinese: 徒中壯士願從者十餘人。
translations.literal: Among the convicts over ten brave men wished to follow him.
translations.idiomatic: Among the convicts, over ten brave men wished to follow him.

context.previous: 曰：「公等皆去，吾亦從此逝矣！」
context.next: 高祖被酒，夜徑澤中，令一人行前。

translations.chinese: 高祖被酒，夜徑澤中，令一人行前。
translations.literal: Gao Zu, intoxicated, traveled by night through the marshes and ordered one man to go ahead.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Gaozu, intoxicated, traveled by night through the marshes and ordered one man to go ahead.

context.previous: 徒中壯士願從者十餘人。
context.next: 行前者還報曰：「前有大蛇當徑，願還。」

translations.chinese: 行前者還報曰：「前有大蛇當徑，願還。」
translations.literal: The man going ahead returned and reported: "There is a great snake blocking the path ahead; we should turn back."
translations.idiomatic: The man going ahead returned and reported: 'There is a great snake blocking the path ahead. We should turn back.''

context.previous: 高祖被酒，夜徑澤中，令一人行前。
context.next: 高祖醉，曰：「壯士行，何畏！」

translations.chinese: 高祖醉，曰：「壯士行，何畏！」
translations.literal: Gao Zu, drunk, said: "A brave man goes forward—what is there to fear!"
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Gaozu, drunk, said: 'A brave man goes forward—what is there to fear!''

context.previous: 行前者還報曰：「前有大蛇當徑，願還。」
context.next: 乃前，拔劍擊斬蛇。

translations.chinese: 乃前，拔劍擊斬蛇。
translations.literal: He then went forward, drew his sword, and struck and beheaded the snake.
translations.idiomatic: He stepped forward, drew his sword, and cut off the snake's head.

context.previous: 高祖醉，曰：「壯士行，何畏！」
context.next: 蛇遂分為兩，徑開。

translations.chinese: 蛇遂分為兩，徑開。
translations.literal: The snake was split in two and the path opened.
translations.idiomatic: The snake split in two and the path opened.

translations.idiomatic: Zhou Shi sent someone to tell Yong Chi: 'Feng was formerly a relocated town from Liang.'

context.next: 今魏地已定者數十城。

translations.chinese: 今魏地已定者數十城。
translations.literal: Now the Wei territory that has been settled numbers several tens of cities.
translations.idiomatic: Wei has already pacified dozens of cities.'

context.previous: 周市使人謂雍齒曰：「豐，故梁徙也。
context.next: 齒今下魏，魏以齒為侯守豐。

translations.chinese: 齒今下魏，魏以齒為侯守豐。
translations.literal: If Chi now surrenders to Wei, Wei will make Chi a marquis defending Feng.
translations.idiomatic: If Yong Chi surrenders to Wei now, Wei will make him Marquis of Feng.'

context.previous: 今魏地已定者數十城。
context.next: 不下，且屠豐。」

translations.chinese: 不下，且屠豐。」
translations.literal: If you do not surrender, we will massacre Feng."
translations.idiomatic: If you don't surrender, we'll massacre Feng.''

context.previous: 齒今下魏，魏以齒為侯守豐。
context.next: 雍齒雅不欲屬沛公，及魏招之，即反為魏守豐。

translations.chinese: 雍齒雅不欲屬沛公，及魏招之，即反為魏守豐。
translations.literal: Yong Chi had long been unwilling to be subordinate to the Duke of Pei; when Wei recruited him, he immediately rebelled and defended Feng for Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Yong Chi had long been unwilling to serve under the Duke of Pei. When Wei recruited him, he immediately defected and defended Feng for Wei.

context.previous: 不下，且屠豐。」
context.next: 沛公引兵攻豐，不能取。

translations.chinese: 沛公引兵攻豐，不能取。
translations.literal: The Duke of Pei led troops to attack Feng but could not take it.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Pei led troops to attack Feng but could not capture it.

context.previous: 雍齒雅不欲屬沛公，及魏招之，即反為魏守豐。
context.next: 沛公病，還之沛。

translations.chinese: 沛公病，還之沛。
translations.literal: The Duke of Pei fell ill and returned to Pei.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Pei fell ill and went back to Pei.

context.previous: 沛公引兵攻豐，不能取。
context.next: 沛公怨雍齒與豐子弟叛之，聞東陽甯君、秦嘉立景駒為假王，在留，乃往從之，欲請兵以攻豐。

translations.chinese: 沛公怨雍齒與豐子弟叛之，聞東陽甯君、秦嘉立景駒為假王，在留，乃往從之，欲請兵以攻豐。
translations.literal: The Duke of Pei resented that Yong Chi and the sons and younger brothers of Feng had betrayed him; hearing that Lord Ning of Dongyang and Qin Jia had installed Jing Ju as Provisional King at Liu, he went to join them, wishing to request troops to attack Feng.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Pei resented Yong Chi and the young men of Feng for betraying him. Hearing that Lord Ning of Dongyang and Qin Jia had installed Jing Ju as Provisional King at Liu, he went to join them, hoping to request troops to attack Feng.

context.previous: 沛公病，還之沛。
context.next: 是時秦將章邯從陳，別將司馬夷將兵北定楚地，屠相，至碭。

translations.chinese: 是時秦將章邯從陳，別將司馬夷將兵北定楚地，屠相，至碭。
translations.literal: At this time Qin general Zhang Han came from Chen; a separate general, Sima Yi, led troops to pacify Chu territory to the north, massacred Xiang, and reached Dang.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Qin general Zhang Han came from Chen. A separate commander, Sima Yi, led troops to pacify northern Chu territory, massacred Xiang, and reached Dang.

context.previous: 沛公怨雍齒與豐子弟叛之，聞東陽甯君、秦嘉立景駒為假王，在留，乃往從之，欲請兵以攻豐。
context.next: 東陽甯君、沛公引兵西，與戰蕭西，不利。

translations.chinese: 東陽甯君、沛公引兵西，與戰蕭西，不利。
translations.literal: Lord Ning of Dongyang and the Duke of Pei led troops west and fought with them west of Xiao; it went unfavorably.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Ning of Dongyang and the Duke of Pei led troops west and fought Qin forces west of Xiao, but were defeated.

context.previous: 是時秦將章邯從陳，別將司馬夷將兵北定楚地，屠相，至碭。
context.next: 還收兵聚留，引兵攻碭，三日乃取碭。

translations.chinese: 還收兵聚留，引兵攻碭，三日乃取碭。
translations.literal: They returned to gather troops and assembled at Liu, then led troops to attack Dang, taking it after three days.
translations.idiomatic: They retreated to gather troops and assembled at Liu, then led troops to attack Dang, capturing it after three days.

context.previous: 東陽甯君、沛公引兵西，與戰蕭西，不利。
context.next: 因收碭兵，得五六千人。

translations.chinese: 因收碭兵，得五六千人。
translations.literal: Consequently gathering Dang's troops, they obtained five or six thousand men.
translations.idiomatic: They consequently recruited troops from Dang, obtaining five or six thousand men.

context.previous: 還收兵聚留，引兵攻碭，三日乃取碭。
context.next: 攻下邑，拔之。

translations.chinese: 攻下邑，拔之。
translations.literal: They attacked Xiayi and took it.
translations.idiomatic: They attacked Xiayi and captured it.

context.previous: 因收碭兵，得五六千人。
context.next: 還軍豐。

translations.chinese: 還軍豐。
translations.literal: They returned the army to Feng.
translations.idiomatic: They brought the army back to Feng.

context.previous: 攻下邑，拔之。
context.next: 聞項梁在薛，從騎百餘往見之。

translations.chinese: 聞項梁在薛，從騎百餘往見之。
translations.literal: Hearing that Xiang Liang was at Xue, he went with over a hundred cavalry to see him.
translations.idiomatic: Hearing that Xiang Liang was at Xue, he went with over a hundred cavalry to meet him.

context.previous: 還軍豐。
context.next: 項梁益沛公卒五千人，五大夫將十人。

translations.chinese: 項梁益沛公卒五千人，五大夫將十人。
translations.literal: Xiang Liang augmented the Duke of Pei's troops with five thousand men and ten commanders of the fifth rank.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang augmented the Duke of Pei's forces with five thousand troops and ten commanders of the fifth rank.

context.previous: 聞項梁在薛，從騎百餘往見之。
context.next: 沛公還，引兵攻豐。

translations.chinese: 沛公還，引兵攻豐。
translations.literal: The Duke of Pei returned and led troops to attack Feng.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Pei came back and led his troops to attack Feng.

context.previous: 項梁益沛公卒五千人，五大夫將十人。

translations.chinese: 從項梁月餘，項羽已拔襄城還。
translations.literal: Following Xiang Liang for over a month, Xiang Yu had already taken Xiangcheng and returned.
translations.idiomatic: He followed Xiang Liang for over a month, during which Xiang Yu had already captured Xiangcheng and returned.

context.next: 項梁盡召別將居薛。

translations.chinese: 項梁盡召別將居薛。
translations.literal: Xiang Liang summoned all the separate generals to assemble at Xue.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang called together all the independent generals at Xue.

context.previous: 從項梁月餘，項羽已拔襄城還。
context.next: 聞陳王定死，因立楚後懷王孫心為楚王，治盱臺。

translations.chinese: 聞陳王定死，因立楚後懷王孫心為楚王，治盱臺。
translations.literal: Hearing that King Chen had definitely died, they consequently installed Xin, grandson of the former King Huai of Chu, as King of Chu, governing from Xutai.
translations.idiomatic: Upon learning that King Chen was definitely dead, they installed Xin—grandson of the former King Huai of Chu—as King of Chu, governing from Xutai.

context.previous: 項梁盡召別將居薛。
context.next: 項梁號武信君。

translations.chinese: 項梁號武信君。
translations.literal: Xiang Liang took the title Lord of Martial Trust.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang took the title Lord Wu Xin.

context.previous: 聞陳王定死，因立楚後懷王孫心為楚王，治盱臺。
context.next: 居數月，北攻亢父，救東阿，破秦軍。

translations.chinese: 居數月，北攻亢父，救東阿，破秦軍。
translations.literal: After several months, they attacked Kangfu to the north, rescued Dong'e, and broke the Qin army.
translations.idiomatic: After several months, they attacked Kangfu to the north, rescued Dong'e, and defeated the Qin army.

context.previous: 項梁號武信君。
context.next: 齊軍歸，楚獨追北，使沛公、項羽別攻城陽，屠之。

translations.chinese: 齊軍歸，楚獨追北，使沛公、項羽別攻城陽，屠之。
translations.literal: The Qi army returned; only Chu pursued northward, sending the Duke of Pei and Xiang Yu separately to attack Chengyang and massacre it.
translations.idiomatic: The Qi army retreated. Only Chu pursued northward, sending the Duke of Pei and Xiang Yu separately to attack Chengyang and massacre its inhabitants.

context.previous: 居數月，北攻亢父，救東阿，破秦軍。
context.next: 軍濮陽之東，與秦軍戰，破之。

translations.chinese: 軍濮陽之東，與秦軍戰，破之。
translations.literal: They encamped east of Puyang and fought with the Qin army, breaking them.
translations.idiomatic: They encamped east of Puyang and fought the Qin army, defeating them.

context.previous: 齊軍歸，楚獨追北，使沛公、項羽別攻城陽，屠之。

translations.chinese: 秦軍復振，守濮陽，環水。
translations.literal: The Qin army rallied again, defended Puyang, and surrounded by water.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin army rallied again, defended Puyang, and was surrounded by water.

context.next: 楚軍去而攻定陶，定陶未下。

translations.chinese: 楚軍去而攻定陶，定陶未下。
translations.literal: The Chu army departed and attacked Dingtao, but Dingtao did not fall.
translations.idiomatic: The Chu army departed and attacked Dingtao, but could not capture it.

context.previous: 秦軍復振，守濮陽，環水。
context.next: 沛公與項羽西略地至雍丘之下，與秦軍戰，大破之，斬李由。

translations.chinese: 沛公與項羽西略地至雍丘之下，與秦軍戰，大破之，斬李由。
translations.literal: The Duke of Pei and Xiang Yu went west taking territory to below Yongqiu, fought with the Qin army, greatly broke them, and beheaded Li You.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Pei and Xiang Yu went west seizing territory as far as below Yongqiu. They fought the Qin army, decisively defeated them, and beheaded Li You.

context.previous: 楚軍去而攻定陶，定陶未下。
context.next: 還攻外黃，外黃未下。

translations.chinese: 還攻外黃，外黃未下。
translations.literal: Returning they attacked Waihuang, but Waihuang did not fall.
translations.idiomatic: Returning, they attacked Waihuang, but could not capture it.

context.previous: 沛公與項羽西略地至雍丘之下，與秦軍戰，大破之，斬李由。

translations.chinese: 項梁再破秦軍，有驕色。
translations.literal: Xiang Liang twice broke the Qin army and showed an arrogant bearing.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Liang had twice defeated the Qin army and showed an arrogant demeanor.

context.next: 宋義諫，不聽。

translations.chinese: 宋義諫，不聽。
translations.literal: Song Yi remonstrated, but he did not listen.
translations.idiomatic: Song Yi advised him against it, but he did not listen.

context.previous: 項梁再破秦軍，有驕色。
context.next: 秦益章邯兵，夜銜枚擊項梁，大破之定陶，項梁死。

translations.chinese: 秦益章邯兵，夜銜枚擊項梁，大破之定陶，項梁死。
translations.literal: Qin reinforced Zhang Han's troops; by night with gags in their mouths they struck Xiang Liang, greatly broke him at Dingtao; Xiang Liang died.
translations.idiomatic: Qin reinforced Zhang Han's troops. By night, with gags in their mouths to maintain silence, they struck Xiang Liang, decisively defeating him at Dingtao. Xiang Liang died.

context.previous: 宋義諫，不聽。
context.next: 沛公與項羽方攻陳留，聞項梁死，引兵與呂將軍俱東。

translations.chinese: 沛公與項羽方攻陳留，聞項梁死，引兵與呂將軍俱東。
translations.literal: The Duke of Pei and Xiang Yu were attacking Chenliu when they heard of Xiang Liang's death; they led their troops eastward together with General Lü.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Pei and Xiang Yu were in the midst of attacking Chenliu when they heard of Xiang Liang's death. They led their troops eastward together with General Lü.

context.previous: 秦益章邯兵，夜銜枚擊項梁，大破之定陶，項梁死。
context.next: 呂臣軍彭城東，項羽軍彭城西，沛公軍碭。

translations.chinese: 呂臣軍彭城東，項羽軍彭城西，沛公軍碭。
translations.literal: Lü Chen's army was east of Pengcheng, Xiang Yu's army west of Pengcheng, and the Duke of Pei's army at Dang.
translations.idiomatic: Lü Chen's forces were east of Pengcheng, Xiang Yu's west of Pengcheng, and the Duke of Pei's at Dang.

context.previous: 沛公與項羽方攻陳留，聞項梁死，引兵與呂將軍俱東。

translations.chinese: 章邯已破項梁軍，則以為楚地兵不足憂，乃渡河，北擊趙，大破之。
translations.literal: Having broken Xiang Liang's army, Zhang Han considered that Chu territory's troops were not worth worrying about, so he crossed the Yellow River and attacked Zhao to the north, greatly breaking them.
translations.idiomatic: Having defeated Xiang Liang's army, Zhang Han considered Chu's troops no longer a threat. He crossed the Yellow River north and attacked Zhao, decisively defeating them.

context.next: 當是之時，趙歇為王，秦將王離圍之鉅鹿城，此所謂河北之軍也。

translations.chinese: 當是之時，趙歇為王，秦將王離圍之鉅鹿城，此所謂河北之軍也。
translations.literal: At that time, Zhao Xie was king; Qin general Wang Li surrounded him at Julu city—this was called the army north of the Yellow River.
translations.idiomatic: At that time, Zhao Xie was king. Qin general Wang Li besieged him at Julu city—this was called the army north of the Yellow River.

context.previous: 章邯已破項梁軍，則以為楚地兵不足憂，乃渡河，北擊趙，大破之。

translations.chinese: 秦二世三年，楚懷王見項梁軍破，恐，徙盱臺都彭城，并呂臣、項羽軍自將之。
translations.literal: In the third year of the Second Emperor of Qin, King Huai of Chu saw that Xiang Liang's army was broken and was afraid; he moved from Xutai and made his capital at Pengcheng, combining Lü Chen's and Xiang Yu's armies to command them himself.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year of Qin's Second Emperor, King Huai of Chu saw that Xiang Liang's army had been defeated and grew fearful. He moved his capital from Xutai to Pengcheng and personally took command of Lü Chen's and Xiang Yu's combined armies.

context.next: 以沛公為碭郡長，封為武安侯，將碭郡兵。

translations.chinese: 以沛公為碭郡長，封為武安侯，將碭郡兵。
translations.literal: He made the Duke of Pei Administrator of Dang Commandery, enfeoffed him as Marquis of Wu'an, and had him command the troops of Dang Commandery.
translations.idiomatic: He appointed the Duke of Pei as Governor of Dang Commandery, enfeoffed him as Marquis of Wu'an, and put him in command of Dang's troops.

context.previous: 秦二世三年，楚懷王見項梁軍破，恐，徙盱臺都彭城，并呂臣、項羽軍自將之。
context.next: 封項羽為長安侯，號為魯公。

translations.chinese: 封項羽為長安侯，號為魯公。
translations.literal: He enfeoffed Xiang Yu as Marquis of Chang'an and gave him the title Duke of Lu.
translations.idiomatic: He enfeoffed Xiang Yu as Marquis of Chang'an with the title Duke of Lu.

context.previous: 以沛公為碭郡長，封為武安侯，將碭郡兵。
context.next: 呂臣為司徒，其父呂青為令尹。

translations.chinese: 呂臣為司徒，其父呂青為令尹。
translations.literal: Lü Chen was made Minister of Ceremonies, and his father Lü Qing Grand Councillor.
translations.idiomatic: Lü Chen was appointed Minister of Ceremonies, and his father Lü Qing became Grand Councillor.

context.previous: 封項羽為長安侯，號為魯公。

translations.chinese: 趙數請救，懷王乃以宋義為上將軍，項羽為次將，范增為末將，北救趙。
translations.literal: Zhao repeatedly requested rescue; King Huai then made Song Yi Supreme General, Xiang Yu second general, and Fan Zeng final general, to rescue Zhao to the north.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao repeatedly requested rescue. King Huai then appointed Song Yi as Supreme General, Xiang Yu as Deputy General, and Fan Zeng as Rear General, to go north and rescue Zhao.

context.next: 令沛公西略地入關。

translations.chinese: 令沛公西略地入關。
translations.literal: He ordered the Duke of Pei to go west taking territory and enter the passes.
translations.idiomatic: He ordered the Duke of Pei to go west, seize territory, and enter the passes.

context.previous: 趙數請救，懷王乃以宋義為上將軍，項羽為次將，范增為末將，北救趙。
context.next: 與諸將約，先入定關中者王之。

translations.chinese: 與諸將約，先入定關中者王之。
translations.literal: Making an agreement with all the generals: he who first enters and settles Guanzhong shall be its king.
translations.idiomatic: He made an agreement with all the generals: whoever first enters and pacifies Guanzhong shall be made its king.

context.previous: 令沛公西略地入關。

translations.chinese: 當是時，秦兵彊，常乘勝逐北，諸將莫利先入關。
translations.literal: At that time, Qin troops were strong and constantly rode victory pursuing northward; none of the generals found it advantageous to enter the passes first.
translations.idiomatic: At that time, Qin troops were strong and constantly pressing their victories northward. None of the generals saw advantage in entering the passes first.

context.next: 獨項羽怨秦破項梁軍，奮，願與沛公西入關。

translations.chinese: 獨項羽怨秦破項梁軍，奮，願與沛公西入關。
translations.literal: Only Xiang Yu resented that Qin had broken Xiang Liang's army and was determined, wishing to go west into the passes with the Duke of Pei.
translations.idiomatic: Only Xiang Yu, resentful that Qin had destroyed his uncle Xiang Liang's army, was determined and wished to go west into the passes with the Duke of Pei.

context.previous: 當是時，秦兵彊，常乘勝逐北，諸將莫利先入關。
context.next: 懷王諸老將皆曰：「項羽為人彊悍猾賊。

translations.chinese: 懷王諸老將皆曰：「項羽為人彊悍猾賊。
translations.literal: King Huai's various old generals all said: "Xiang Yu as a person is fierce, violent, cunning, and cruel.
translations.idiomatic: King Huai's veteran generals all said: 'Xiang Yu is fierce, violent, cunning, and cruel.'

context.previous: 獨項羽怨秦破項梁軍，奮，願與沛公西入關。
context.next: 項羽嘗攻襄城，襄城無遺類，皆阬之，諸所過無不殘滅。

translations.chinese: 項羽嘗攻襄城，襄城無遺類，皆阬之，諸所過無不殘滅。
translations.literal: When Xiang Yu attacked Xiangcheng, none of Xiangcheng's population remained—all were buried alive; wherever he passes he completely destroys everything.
translations.idiomatic: When Xiang Yu attacked Xiangcheng, he left no survivors—all were buried alive. Wherever he goes, he completely destroys everything.

context.previous: 懷王諸老將皆曰：「項羽為人彊悍猾賊。
context.next: 且楚數進取，前陳王、項梁皆敗。

translations.chinese: 且楚數進取，前陳王、項梁皆敗。
translations.literal: Moreover, Chu has repeatedly advanced offensively; previously King Chen and Xiang Liang both were defeated.
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, Chu has repeatedly gone on the offensive, but previously King Chen and Xiang Liang both were defeated.

context.previous: 項羽嘗攻襄城，襄城無遺類，皆阬之，諸所過無不殘滅。
context.next: 不如更遣長者扶義而西，告諭秦父兄。

translations.chinese: 不如更遣長者扶義而西，告諭秦父兄。
translations.literal: It would be better to send an elder to uphold righteousness and go west, to inform and instruct the fathers and elder brothers of Qin.
translations.idiomatic: It would be better to send an elder to uphold righteousness and go west, to inform and persuade the fathers and brothers of Qin.

context.previous: 且楚數進取，前陳王、項梁皆敗。
context.next: 秦父兄苦其主久矣，今誠得長者往，毋侵暴，宜可下。

translations.chinese: 秦父兄苦其主久矣，今誠得長者往，毋侵暴，宜可下。
translations.literal: The fathers and elder brothers of Qin have long suffered under their lord; now if we truly obtain an elder to go who does not invade or commit violence, they should be amenable to surrender.
translations.idiomatic: The fathers and brothers of Qin have long suffered under their ruler. If we truly send a benevolent elder who commits no violence, they should be amenable to surrender.

context.previous: 不如更遣長者扶義而西，告諭秦父兄。
context.next: 今項羽彊悍，今不可遣。

translations.chinese: 今項羽彊悍，今不可遣。
translations.literal: Now Xiang Yu is fierce and violent; he cannot be sent.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu is too fierce and violent to be sent away.

context.previous: 秦父兄苦其主久矣，今誠得長者往，毋侵暴，宜可下。
context.next: 獨沛公素寬大長者，可遣。」

translations.chinese: 獨沛公素寬大長者，可遣。」
translations.literal: Only the Duke of Pei has always been generous and magnanimous, an elder; he can be sent."
translations.idiomatic: Only the Duke of Pei has always been generous and magnanimous, a true elder. He can be sent.''

context.previous: 今項羽彊悍，今不可遣。
context.next: 卒不許項羽，而遣沛公西略地，收陳王、項梁散卒。

translations.chinese: 卒不許項羽，而遣沛公西略地，收陳王、項梁散卒。
translations.literal: In the end they did not permit Xiang Yu, but sent the Duke of Pei west to take territory and gather the scattered troops of King Chen and Xiang Liang.
translations.idiomatic: In the end they did not permit Xiang Yu, but sent the Duke of Pei west to seize territory and gather the scattered troops of King Chen and Xiang Liang.

context.previous: 獨沛公素寬大長者，可遣。」
context.next: 乃道碭至成陽，與杠裏秦軍夾壁，破（魏）［秦］二軍。

translations.chinese: 乃道碭至成陽，與杠裏秦軍夾壁，破（魏）［秦］二軍。
translations.literal: They then went by way of Dang to Chengyang and with Qin troops at Gangli faced each other across ramparts, breaking the two Qin armies.
translations.idiomatic: They then went by way of Dang to Chengyang and faced off against Qin troops at Gangli across ramparts, defeating the two Qin armies.

context.previous: 卒不許項羽，而遣沛公西略地，收陳王、項梁散卒。
context.next: 楚軍出兵擊王離，大破之。

translations.chinese: 楚軍出兵擊王離，大破之。
translations.literal: The Chu army sent out troops to strike Wang Li and greatly broke him.
translations.idiomatic: The Chu army sent out troops to attack Wang Li and decisively defeated him.

context.previous: 乃道碭至成陽，與杠裏秦軍夾壁，破（魏）［秦］二軍。

translations.chinese: 沛公引兵西，遇彭越昌邑，因與俱攻秦軍，戰不利。
translations.literal: The Duke of Pei led troops west and met Peng Yue at Changyi; consequently they together attacked the Qin army, but the battle went unfavorably.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Pei led troops west and met Peng Yue at Changyi. They consequently attacked the Qin army together, but the battle went unfavorably.

context.next: 還至栗，遇剛武侯，奪其軍，可四千餘人，并之。

translations.chinese: 還至栗，遇剛武侯，奪其軍，可四千餘人，并之。
translations.literal: Returning to reach Li, he met Marquis Gangwu, seized his army of over four thousand men, and combined them.
translations.idiomatic: Returning to Li, he met Marquis Gangwu, seized his army of over four thousand men, and incorporated them.

context.previous: 沛公引兵西，遇彭越昌邑，因與俱攻秦軍，戰不利。
context.next: 與魏將皇欣、魏申徒武蒲之軍并攻昌邑，昌邑未拔。

translations.chinese: 與魏將皇欣、魏申徒武蒲之軍并攻昌邑，昌邑未拔。
translations.literal: Together with Wei generals Huang Xin, Wei Shentu, and the army of Wu Pu, they jointly attacked Changyi, but Changyi did not fall.
translations.idiomatic: Together with Wei generals Huang Xin, Wei Shentu, and Wu Pu's army, they jointly attacked Changyi, but could not capture it.

context.previous: 還至栗，遇剛武侯，奪其軍，可四千餘人，并之。
context.next: 西過高陽。

translations.chinese: 西過高陽。
translations.literal: Going west they passed Gaoyang.
translations.idiomatic: Going west, they passed Gaoyang.

context.previous: 與魏將皇欣、魏申徒武蒲之軍并攻昌邑，昌邑未拔。
context.next: 酈食其（謂）［為］監門，曰：「諸將過此者多，吾視沛公大人長者。」

translations.chinese: 酈食其（謂）［為］監門，曰：「諸將過此者多，吾視沛公大人長者。」
translations.literal: Li Yiji was gate guard and said: "Many generals have passed through here; I observe that the Duke of Pei is a great man and elder."
translations.idiomatic: Li Yiji was gate guard and said: 'Many generals have passed through here. I observe that the Duke of Pei is a great man and true elder.''

context.previous: 西過高陽。
context.next: 乃求見說沛公。

translations.chinese: 乃求見說沛公。
translations.literal: He then sought an audience to persuade the Duke of Pei.
translations.idiomatic: He requested an audience to persuade the Duke of Pei.

context.previous: 酈食其（謂）［為］監門，曰：「諸將過此者多，吾視沛公大人長者。」
context.next: 沛公方踞床，使兩女子洗足。

translations.chinese: 沛公方踞床，使兩女子洗足。
translations.literal: The Duke of Pei was squatting on the bed having two women wash his feet.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Pei was sitting cross-legged on the bed, having two women wash his feet.

context.previous: 乃求見說沛公。
context.next: 酈生不拜，長揖，曰：「足下必欲誅無道秦，不宜踞見長者。」

translations.chinese: 酈生不拜，長揖，曰：「足下必欲誅無道秦，不宜踞見長者。」
translations.literal: Li Sheng did not bow but made a long salute, saying: "If you wish to execute the lawless Qin, you should not squat to receive an elder."
translations.idiomatic: Li Sheng did not bow but made a deep bow, saying: 'If you wish to execute the lawless Qin, you should not sit cross-legged to receive an elder.''

context.previous: 沛公方踞床，使兩女子洗足。
context.next: 於是沛公起，攝衣謝之，延上坐。

translations.chinese: 於是沛公起，攝衣謝之，延上坐。
translations.literal: Thereupon the Duke of Pei rose, adjusted his clothing, apologized, and invited him to the seat of honor.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Pei stood up, straightened his clothes, apologized, and invited him to the seat of honor.

context.previous: 酈生不拜，長揖，曰：「足下必欲誅無道秦，不宜踞見長者。」
context.next: 食其說沛公襲陳留，得秦積粟。

translations.chinese: 食其說沛公襲陳留，得秦積粟。
translations.literal: Li Yiji persuaded the Duke of Pei to attack Chenliu and obtain Qin's accumulated grain.
translations.idiomatic: Li Yiji persuaded the Duke of Pei to raid Chenliu and seize Qin's stockpiled grain.

context.previous: 於是沛公起，攝衣謝之，延上坐。
context.next: 乃以酈食其為廣野君，酈商為將，將陳留兵，與偕攻開封，開封未拔。

translations.chinese: 乃以酈食其為廣野君，酈商為將，將陳留兵，與偕攻開封，開封未拔。
translations.literal: He then made Li Yiji Lord of Guangye and Li Shang a general to command the troops of Chenliu and together attack Kaifeng, but Kaifeng did not fall.
translations.idiomatic: He then made Li Yiji Lord of Guangye and Li Shang a general to command Chenliu's troops. Together they attacked Kaifeng, but could not capture it.

context.previous: 食其說沛公襲陳留，得秦積粟。
context.next: 西與秦將楊熊戰白馬，又戰曲遇東，大破之。

translations.chinese: 西與秦將楊熊戰白馬，又戰曲遇東，大破之。
translations.literal: Going west they fought with Qin general Yang Xiong at Baima, and again fought east of Quyu, greatly breaking them.
translations.idiomatic: Going west, they fought Qin general Yang Xiong at Baima, and again fought east of Quyu, decisively defeating them.

context.previous: 乃以酈食其為廣野君，酈商為將，將陳留兵，與偕攻開封，開封未拔。
context.next: 楊熊走之滎陽，二世使使者斬以徇。

translations.chinese: 楊熊走之滎陽，二世使使者斬以徇。
translations.literal: Yang Xiong fled to Yingyang; the Second Emperor sent an envoy to behead him as a warning.
translations.idiomatic: Yang Xiong fled to Yingyang. The Second Emperor sent an envoy to behead him as a public warning.

context.previous: 西與秦將楊熊戰白馬，又戰曲遇東，大破之。
context.next: 南攻潁陽，屠之。

translations.chinese: 南攻潁陽，屠之。
translations.literal: They attacked Yingyang to the south and massacred it.
translations.idiomatic: They attacked Yingyang to the south and massacred its inhabitants.

context.previous: 楊熊走之滎陽，二世使使者斬以徇。
context.next: 因張良遂略韓地轘轅。

translations.chinese: 因張良遂略韓地轘轅。
translations.literal: Through Zhang Liang they then took the territory of Han at Huanyuan.
translations.idiomatic: Through Zhang Liang they then seized Han territory at Huanyuan.

context.previous: 南攻潁陽，屠之。

translations.chinese: 當是時，趙別將司馬卬方欲渡河入關，沛公乃北攻平陰，絕河津。
translations.literal: At that time, Zhao's separate general Sima Ang was about to cross the Yellow River to enter the passes; the Duke of Pei then attacked Pingyin to the north, cutting off the river ford.
translations.idiomatic: At that time, Zhao's separate general Sima Ang was about to cross the Yellow River into the passes. The Duke of Pei then attacked Pingyin to the north, cutting off the river crossing.

context.next: 南，戰雒陽東，軍不利，還至陽城，收軍中馬騎，與南陽守齮戰犨東，破之。

translations.chinese: 南，戰雒陽東，軍不利，還至陽城，收軍中馬騎，與南陽守齮戰犨東，破之。
translations.literal: Going south, they fought east of Luoyang; the army went unfavorably, so they returned to Yangcheng, gathered cavalry within the army, and fought with Nanyang Administrator Qi east of Chu, breaking him.
translations.idiomatic: Going south, they fought east of Luoyang, but the army fared poorly. They returned to Yangcheng, gathered cavalry from their forces, and fought Nanyang Administrator Qi east of Chu, defeating him.

context.previous: 當是時，趙別將司馬卬方欲渡河入關，沛公乃北攻平陰，絕河津。
context.next: 略南陽郡，南陽守齮走，保城守宛。

translations.chinese: 略南陽郡，南陽守齮走，保城守宛。
translations.literal: They took Nanyang Commandery; Administrator Qi fled and defended and held the city of Wan.
translations.idiomatic: They seized Nanyang Commandery. Administrator Qi fled and defended the city of Wan.

context.previous: 南，戰雒陽東，軍不利，還至陽城，收軍中馬騎，與南陽守齮戰犨東，破之。
context.next: 沛公引兵過而西。

translations.chinese: 沛公引兵過而西。
translations.literal: The Duke of Pei led his troops to pass by and go west.
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Pei led his troops past and continued west.

context.previous: 略南陽郡，南陽守齮走，保城守宛。
context.next: 張良諫曰：「沛公雖欲急入關，秦兵尚眾，距險。

translations.chinese: 張良諫曰：「沛公雖欲急入關，秦兵尚眾，距險。
translations.literal: Zhang Liang remonstrated, saying: "Though the Duke of Pei wishes to urgently enter the passes, Qin troops are still numerous and hold dangerous positions.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Liang remonstrated, saying: 'Though the Duke of Pei wishes to urgently enter the passes, Qin troops are still numerous and hold dangerous defensive positions.'

context.previous: 沛公引兵過而西。
context.next: 今不下宛，宛從後擊，彊秦在前，此危道也。」

translations.chinese: 今不下宛，宛從後擊，彊秦在前，此危道也。」
translations.literal: Now if we do not take Wan, Wan will strike from behind, while strong Qin is ahead—this is a dangerous path."
translations.idiomatic: If we don't take Wan now, Wan will strike from behind while strong Qin forces are ahead—this is a dangerous path.''

context.previous: 張良諫曰：「沛公雖欲急入關，秦兵尚眾，距險。
context.next: 於是沛公乃夜引兵從他道還，更旗幟，黎明，圍宛城三匝。

translations.chinese: 於是沛公乃夜引兵從他道還，更旗幟，黎明，圍宛城三匝。
translations.literal: Thereupon the Duke of Pei led his troops by night from another road and returned, changed flags and banners, and at dawn surrounded Wan city three times round.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon the Duke of Pei led his troops by night along another road back, changed the flags and banners, and at dawn surrounded Wan city three times over.

context.previous: 今不下宛，宛從後擊，彊秦在前，此危道也。」
context.next: 南陽守欲自剄。

translations.chinese: 南陽守欲自剄。
translations.literal: The Administrator of Nanyang wished to slit his own throat.
translations.idiomatic: The Administrator of Nanyang wished to commit suicide.

context.previous: 於是沛公乃夜引兵從他道還，更旗幟，黎明，圍宛城三匝。
context.next: 其舍人陳恢曰：「死未晚也。」

translations.chinese: 其舍人陳恢曰：「死未晚也。」
translations.literal: His retainer Chen Hui said: "It is not too late to die."
translations.idiomatic: His retainer Chen Hui said: 'It is not too late to die.''

context.previous: 南陽守欲自剄。
context.next: 乃踰城見沛公，曰：「臣聞足下約，先入咸陽者王之。

translations.chinese: 乃踰城見沛公，曰：「臣聞足下約，先入咸陽者王之。
translations.literal: He then climbed over the city wall to see the Duke of Pei and said: "I have heard of your agreement: he who first enters Xianyang shall be its king.
translations.idiomatic: He then climbed over the city wall to see the Duke of Pei and said: 'I have heard of your agreement: whoever first enters Xianyang shall be made its king.'

context.previous: 其舍人陳恢曰：「死未晚也。」
context.next: 今足下留守宛。

translations.chinese: 今足下留守宛。
translations.literal: Now you remain besieging Wan.
translations.idiomatic: Now you remain besieging Wan.'

context.previous: 乃踰城見沛公，曰：「臣聞足下約，先入咸陽者王之。
context.next: 宛，大郡之都也，連城數十，人民眾，積蓄多，吏人自以為降必死，故皆堅守乘城。

translations.chinese: 宛，大郡之都也，連城數十，人民眾，積蓄多，吏人自以為降必死，故皆堅守乘城。
translations.literal: Wan is the capital of a great commandery with dozens of connected cities, numerous people, and abundant stores; the officials and people believe that if they surrender they will certainly die, therefore all firmly defend and man the walls.
translations.idiomatic: Wan is the capital of a major commandery with dozens of connected cities, numerous people, and abundant supplies. The officials and people believe that if they surrender they will certainly die, so they all defend firmly and man the walls.

context.previous: 今足下留守宛。
context.next: 今足下盡日止攻，士死傷者必多；

translations.chinese: 今足下盡日止攻，士死傷者必多；
translations.literal: Now if you spend the whole day attacking, officers and troops who die or are wounded will certainly be many;
translations.idiomatic: If you spend the whole day attacking now, many officers and troops will certainly die or be wounded;

context.previous: 宛，大郡之都也，連城數十，人民眾，積蓄多，吏人自以為降必死，故皆堅守乘城。
context.next: 引兵去宛，宛必隨足下後：足下前則失咸陽之約，後又有彊宛之患。

translations.chinese: 引兵去宛，宛必隨足下後：足下前則失咸陽之約，後又有彊宛之患。
translations.literal: if you lead troops away from Wan, Wan will certainly follow behind you; ahead you will lose the agreement about Xianyang, and behind you will have the trouble of strong Wan.
translations.idiomatic: if you lead troops away from Wan, Wan will certainly follow behind you. Ahead you will lose the agreement about Xianyang, and behind you will have the trouble of strong Wan.

context.previous: 今足下盡日止攻，士死傷者必多；
context.next: 為足下計，莫若約降，封其守，因使止守，引其甲卒與之西。

translations.chinese: 為足下計，莫若約降，封其守，因使止守，引其甲卒與之西。
translations.literal: Planning for you, nothing would be better than to agree to accept surrender, enfeoff their administrator, consequently have him remain defending, and lead his armored troops with you westward.
translations.idiomatic: Planning for you, nothing would be better than to agree to accept their surrender, enfeoff their administrator, have him remain defending, and lead his armored troops westward with you.

context.previous: 引兵去宛，宛必隨足下後：足下前則失咸陽之約，後又有彊宛之患。
context.next: 諸城未下者，聞聲爭開門而待，足下通行無所累。」

translations.chinese: 諸城未下者，聞聲爭開門而待，足下通行無所累。」
translations.literal: Cities that have not yet surrendered, hearing the news, will compete to open their gates and wait; you will pass through everywhere without obstruction."
translations.idiomatic: Cities that have not yet surrendered, hearing this news, will compete to open their gates and wait for you. You will pass through everywhere without obstruction.''

context.previous: 為足下計，莫若約降，封其守，因使止守，引其甲卒與之西。
context.next: 沛公曰：「善。」

translations.chinese: 沛公曰：「善。」
translations.literal: The Duke of Pei said: "Excellent."
translations.idiomatic: The Duke of Pei said: 'Excellent.''

context.previous: 諸城未下者，聞聲爭開門而待，足下通行無所累。」
context.next: 乃以宛守為殷侯，封陳恢千戶。

translations.chinese: 乃以宛守為殷侯，封陳恢千戶。
translations.literal: He then made the Administrator of Wan Marquis of Yin and enfeoffed Chen Hui with a thousand households.
translations.idiomatic: He made the Administrator of Wan Marquis of Yin and granted Chen Hui fiefs worth a thousand households.

context.previous: 沛公曰：「善。」
context.next: 引兵西，無不下者。

translations.chinese: 引兵西，無不下者。
translations.literal: Leading troops westward, there were none that did not surrender.
translations.idiomatic: Leading troops westward, none failed to surrender.

context.previous: 乃以宛守為殷侯，封陳恢千戶。
context.next: 至丹水，高武侯鰓、襄侯王陵降西陵。

translations.chinese: 至丹水，高武侯鰓、襄侯王陵降西陵。
translations.literal: Reaching Danshui, Marquis Gaowu Sai and Marquis Xiang Wang Ling surrendered at Xiling.
translations.idiomatic: Upon reaching Danshui, Marquis Gaowu Sai and Marquis Xiang Wang Ling surrendered at Xiling.

context.previous: 引兵西，無不下者。
context.next: 還攻胡陽，遇番君別將梅鋗，與皆，降析、酈。

translations.chinese: 還攻胡陽，遇番君別將梅鋗，與皆，降析、酈。
translations.literal: Returning they attacked Huyang, met Lord Fan's separate general Mei Xuan, went together with them, and accepted the surrender of Xi and Li.
translations.idiomatic: Returning, they attacked Huyang, met Lord Fan's separate general Mei Xuan, joined forces with them, and accepted the surrender of Xi and Li.

context.previous: 至丹水，高武侯鰓、襄侯王陵降西陵。
context.next: 遣魏人甯昌使秦，使者未來。

translations.chinese: 遣魏人甯昌使秦，使者未來。
translations.literal: They dispatched Ning Chang of Wei as envoy to Qin, but the envoy had not yet returned.
translations.idiomatic: They sent Ning Chang of Wei as an envoy to Qin, but he had not yet returned.

context.previous: 還攻胡陽，遇番君別將梅鋗，與皆，降析、酈。
context.next: 是時章邯已以軍降項羽於趙矣。

translations.chinese: 是時章邯已以軍降項羽於趙矣。
translations.literal: At this time Zhang Han had already surrendered his army to Xiang Yu at Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: By this time, Zhang Han had already surrendered his army to Xiang Yu in Zhao.

context.previous: 遣魏人甯昌使秦，使者未來。

translations.chinese: 初，項羽與宋義北救趙，及項羽殺宋義，代為上將軍，諸將黥布皆屬，破秦將王離軍，降章邯，諸侯皆附。
translations.literal: Initially, Xiang Yu with Song Yi had gone north to rescue Zhao; when Xiang Yu killed Song Yi and replaced him as Supreme General, all the generals including Qing Bu were subordinated to him; he broke Qin general Wang Li's army, accepted Zhang Han's surrender, and all the feudal lords attached themselves.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, Xiang Yu and Song Yi had gone north to rescue Zhao. When Xiang Yu killed Song Yi and replaced him as Supreme General, all the generals including Qing Bu were subordinated to him. He defeated Qin general Wang Li's army, accepted Zhang Han's surrender, and all the feudal lords attached themselves.

context.next: 及趙高已殺二世，使人來，欲約分王關中。

translations.chinese: 及趙高已殺二世，使人來，欲約分王關中。
translations.literal: When Zhao Gao had already killed the Second Emperor, he sent men to come wishing to make an agreement to divide and rule Guanzhong.
translations.idiomatic: When Zhao Gao had already assassinated the Second Emperor, he sent messengers wanting to negotiate dividing Guanzhong between them.

context.previous: 初，項羽與宋義北救趙，及項羽殺宋義，代為上將軍，諸將黥布皆屬，破秦將王離軍，降章邯，諸侯皆附。
context.next: 沛公以為詐，乃用張良計，使酈生、陸賈往說秦將，啗以利，因襲攻武關，破之。

translations.chinese: 沛公以為詐，乃用張良計，使酈生、陸賈往說秦將，啗以利，因襲攻武關，破之。

translations.idiomatic: He divided Guanzhong into three parts and installed the three Qin generals: Zhang Han as King of Yong with his capital at Feiqiu;

translations.idiomatic: Guang refused to obey; Zang Tu attacked and killed him at Wuzhong.

translations.idiomatic: He enfeoffed Lord Chengan Chen Yu with three counties in Hejian, making his residence at Nanpi.

translations.idiomatic: He granted Mei Xuan a fief of 100,000 households.

translations.idiomatic: When the King of Han went to his state, King Xiang sent thirty thousand troops to follow. Those from Chu and the feudal lords who admired and followed numbered several tens of thousands. They entered Shizh from south of Du.

translations.literal: As they departed they immediately burned and severed the plank roads to prepare against the feudal lords' troops raiding them, and also to show Xiang Yu they had no intention of going east.
translations.idiomatic: As they left, they immediately burned and destroyed the plank roads to guard against the feudal lords raiding them, and also to show Xiang Yu they had no plans to advance east.

translations.chinese: 至南鄭，諸將及士卒多道亡歸，士卒皆歌思東歸。
translations.literal: Reaching Nanzheng, many generals and officers and troops escaped on the road and returned; the officers and troops all sang songs longing to return east.
translations.idiomatic: Reaching Nanzheng, many generals and officers and troops escaped on the road and returned. The officers and troops all sang songs longing to return east.

context.previous: 去輒燒絕棧道，以備諸侯盜兵襲之，亦示項羽無東意。

translations.literal: Han Xin persuaded the King of Han, saying: "Xiang Yu made kings of generals who had achievements, while the king alone resides at Nanzheng—this is exile.
translations.idiomatic: Han Xin persuaded the King of Han, saying: 'Xiang Yu made kings of generals who had achievements, while the king alone resides at Nanzheng—this is exile.'

context.previous: 至南鄭，諸將及士卒多道亡歸，士卒皆歌思東歸。

translations.chinese: 軍吏士卒皆山東之人也，日夜跂而望歸，及其鋒而用之，可以有大功。
translations.literal: The military officers and troops are all men from east of the mountains; day and night they stand on tiptoe longing to return—use them while they are at their peak and you can achieve great merit.
translations.idiomatic: The military officers and troops are all men from east of the mountains. Day and night they stand on tiptoe longing to return—use them while they are at their peak and you can achieve great merit.

translations.chinese: 天下已定，人皆自寧，不可復用。
translations.literal: Once all under Heaven is settled, people will all seek their own comfort and cannot be used again.
translations.idiomatic: Once the empire is pacified, people will settle into complacency and won't be fit for service again.

context.previous: 軍吏士卒皆山東之人也，日夜跂而望歸，及其鋒而用之，可以有大功。
context.next: 不如決策東鄉，爭權天下。」

translations.chinese: 不如決策東鄉，爭權天下。」
translations.literal: It would be better to make a decisive plan to face east and contend for authority over all under Heaven."
translations.idiomatic: It would be better to make a decisive plan to face east and contend for authority over all under Heaven.''

context.previous: 天下已定，人皆自寧，不可復用。

translations.chinese: 項羽出關，使人徙義帝。
translations.literal: Xiang Yu having left the passes sent men to relocate the Righteous Emperor.
translations.idiomatic: After leaving the passes, Xiang Yu sent men to relocate the Righteous Emperor.

context.next: 曰：「古之帝者地方千里，必居上游。」

translations.chinese: 曰：「古之帝者地方千里，必居上游。」
translations.literal: He said: "Ancient emperors had territories a thousand li square and must reside at the upper reaches."
translations.idiomatic: He said: 'Ancient emperors had territories a thousand li square and must reside at the upper reaches.''

context.previous: 項羽出關，使人徙義帝。

translations.literal: He then sent envoys to relocate the Righteous Emperor to Chen County in Changsha, urged the Righteous Emperor to travel; the assembled ministers gradually betrayed and rebelled against him, and he then secretly ordered the King of Hengshan and King of Linjiang to strike and kill the Righteous Emperor south of the Yangtze.
translations.idiomatic: He then sent envoys to relocate the Righteous Emperor to Chen County in Changsha and urged the Righteous Emperor to travel. The assembled ministers gradually betrayed and rebelled against him, and he then secretly ordered the King of Hengshan and King of Linjiang to strike and kill the Righteous Emperor south of the Yangtze.

context.previous: 曰：「古之帝者地方千里，必居上游。」

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu resented Tian Rong and installed the Qi general Tian Du as King of Qi.

context.previous: 乃使使徙義帝長沙郴縣，趣義帝行，群臣稍倍叛之，乃陰令衡山王、臨江王擊之，殺義帝江南。

translations.idiomatic: He gave Peng Yue a general's seal and ordered him to rebel in Liang territory.

translations.idiomatic: Chen Yu resented that Xiang Yu had not made him king. He had Xia Shuo persuade Tian Rong to request troops to strike Zhang Er.

context.previous: 楚令蕭公角擊彭越，彭越大破之。

translations.literal: Qi gave Chen Yu troops; he struck and broke King Zhang Er of Changshan; Zhang Er fled and submitted to Han.
translations.idiomatic: Qi gave Chen Yu troops. He struck and broke King Zhang Er of Changshan. Zhang Er fled and submitted to Han.

translations.literal: They welcomed King Xie of Zhao from Dai and again installed him as King of Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: They welcomed King Xie of Zhao back from Dai and restored him as King of Zhao.

context.previous: 齊予陳餘兵，擊破常山王張耳，張耳亡歸漢。

translations.literal: The King of Zhao consequently installed Chen Yu as King of Dai.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Zhao consequently installed Chen Yu as King of Dai.

context.previous: 迎趙王歇於代，復立為趙王。

translations.literal: Xiang Yu was greatly enraged and attacked Qi to the north.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu flew into a rage and attacked Qi to the north.

context.previous: 趙王因立陳餘為代王。

translations.chinese: 八月，漢王用韓信之計，從故道還，襲雍王章邯。
translations.literal: In the eighth month, the King of Han used Han Xin's stratagem, returned from the old road, and launched a surprise attack on King Zhang Han of Yong.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth month, the King of Han used Han Xin's stratagem. He returned from the old road and launched a surprise attack on King Zhang Han of Yong.

context.next: 邯迎擊漢陳倉，雍兵敗，還走；

translations.literal: Han met and struck Han at Chencang; the Yong troops were defeated and fled back;
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Han met and struck the Han forces at Chencang. The Yong troops were defeated and fled back;

context.previous: 八月，漢王用韓信之計，從故道還，襲雍王章邯。

translations.idiomatic: They made a stand and fought at Haozhi, were again defeated, and fled to Feiqiu.

context.previous: 邯迎擊漢陳倉，雍兵敗，還走；

translations.literal: The King of Han then settled the territory of Yong.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Han then pacified the territory of Yong.

context.previous: 止戰好畤，又復敗，走廢丘。

translations.idiomatic: Going east to Xianyang, he led troops to besiege the King of Yong at Feiqiu, and dispatched various generals to seize and settle Longxi, Beidi, and Shangjun.

context.previous: 漢王遂定雍地。

translations.idiomatic: He ordered generals Xue Ou and Wang Xi to exit through Wuguan Pass, link up with Wang Ling's troops in Nanyang, and escort his father and Empress Lü from Pei.

context.previous: 東至咸陽，引兵圍雍王廢丘，而遣諸將略定隴西、北地、上郡。
context.next: 楚聞之，發兵距之陽夏，不得前。

translations.literal: Chu heard of this and sent troops to resist them at Yangxia; they could not advance.
translations.idiomatic: Chu got wind of this and dispatched troops to block them at Yangxia; they couldn't proceed.

context.previous: 令將軍薛歐、王吸出武關，因王陵兵南陽，以迎太公、呂後於沛。

translations.idiomatic: He ordered the former magistrate of Wu, Zheng Chang, to become King of Han and resist the Han troops.

context.previous: 楚聞之，發兵距之陽夏，不得前。

translations.idiomatic: In the second year, the King of Han went east taking territory. King Xin of Sai, King Yi of Di, and King Shen Yang of Henan all surrendered.
