translations.literal: King Chang of Han would not obey; he sent Han Xin to strike and break him.
translations.idiomatic: King Chang of Han would not obey. He sent Han Xin to strike and break him.

context.previous: 二年，漢王東略地，塞王欣、翟王翳、河南王申陽皆降。
context.next: 於是置隴西、北地、上郡、渭南、河上、中地郡；

translations.chinese: 於是置隴西、北地、上郡、渭南、河上、中地郡；
translations.literal: Thereupon he established Longxi, Beidi, Shangjun, Weinan, Heshang, and Zhongdi commanderies;
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon he established the commanderies of Longxi, Beidi, Shangjun, Weinan, Heshang, and Zhongdi;

context.previous: 韓王昌不聽，使韓信擊破之。
context.next: 關外置河南郡。

translations.chinese: 關外置河南郡。
translations.literal: outside the passes he established Henan Commandery.
translations.idiomatic: Outside the passes he established Henan Commandery.

context.previous: 於是置隴西、北地、上郡、渭南、河上、中地郡；
context.next: 更立韓太尉信為韓王。

translations.chinese: 更立韓太尉信為韓王。
translations.literal: He reinstalled Han's Grand Commandant Xin as King of Han.
translations.idiomatic: He restored Han's Grand Commandant Xin as King of Han.

context.previous: 關外置河南郡。
context.next: 諸將以萬人若以一郡降者，封萬戶。

translations.chinese: 諸將以萬人若以一郡降者，封萬戶。
translations.literal: Generals who surrendered with ten thousand men or with a commandery were enfeoffed with ten thousand households.
translations.idiomatic: Generals who surrendered with 10,000 men or an entire commandery were granted fiefs of 10,000 households.

context.previous: 更立韓太尉信為韓王。
context.next: 繕治河上塞。

translations.chinese: 繕治河上塞。
translations.literal: They repaired and constructed the fortifications along the Yellow River.
translations.idiomatic: They repaired and reinforced the river defenses.

context.previous: 諸將以萬人若以一郡降者，封萬戶。
context.next: 諸故秦苑囿園池，皆令人得田之，正月，虜雍王弟章平。

translations.chinese: 諸故秦苑囿園池，皆令人得田之，正月，虜雍王弟章平。
translations.literal: All the former Qin parks, gardens, and ponds were permitted for people to farm; in the first month, they captured Chapter Ping, younger brother of the King of Yong.
translations.idiomatic: All the former Qin parks, gardens, and ponds were permitted for people to farm. In the first month, they captured Zhang Ping, younger brother of the King of Yong.

context.previous: 繕治河上塞。
context.next: 大赦罪人。

translations.chinese: 大赦罪人。
translations.literal: They granted a great amnesty to criminals.
translations.idiomatic: A general amnesty was declared for all criminals.

context.previous: 諸故秦苑囿園池，皆令人得田之，正月，虜雍王弟章平。

translations.chinese: 漢王之出關至陜，撫關外父老，還，張耳來見，漢王厚遇之。
translations.literal: When the King of Han left the passes and reached Shan, he consoled the fathers and elders outside the passes, returned, and Zhang Er came to see him; the King of Han treated him generously.
translations.idiomatic: When the King of Han left the passes and reached Shan, he consoled the fathers and elders outside the passes. He returned, and Zhang Er came to see him. The King of Han treated him generously.

translations.chinese: 二月，令除秦社稷，更立漢社稷。
translations.literal: In the second month, he ordered the elimination of Qin's altars of soil and grain and the establishment anew of Han's altars of soil and grain.
translations.idiomatic: In the second month, he ordered Qin's altars of soil and grain demolished and new Han altars established in their place.

translations.chinese: 三月，漢王從臨晉渡，魏王豹將兵從。
translations.literal: In the third month, the King of Han crossed from Linjin; King Bao of Wei led troops to follow.
translations.idiomatic: In the third month, the King of Han crossed from Linjin. King Bao of Wei led troops to follow.

context.next: 下河內，虜殷王，置河內郡。

translations.chinese: 下河內，虜殷王，置河內郡。
translations.literal: He took Henei, captured the King of Yin, and established Henei Commandery.
translations.idiomatic: He conquered Henei, captured the King of Yin, and established Henei as a commandery.

context.previous: 三月，漢王從臨晉渡，魏王豹將兵從。
context.next: 南渡平陰津，至雒陽。

translations.chinese: 南渡平陰津，至雒陽。
translations.literal: He crossed south over Pingyin ford and reached Luoyang.
translations.idiomatic: He crossed south at Pingyin Ford and reached Luoyang.

context.previous: 下河內，虜殷王，置河內郡。
context.next: 新城三老董公遮說漢王以義帝死故。

translations.chinese: 新城三老董公遮說漢王以義帝死故。
translations.literal: Elder Dong Gong of Xincheng blocked the way and persuaded the King of Han with the story of the Righteous Emperor's death.
translations.idiomatic: Elder Dong Gong of Xincheng barred his path and persuaded the King of Han with the tale of the Righteous Emperor's death.

context.previous: 南渡平陰津，至雒陽。
context.next: 漢王聞之，袒而大哭。

translations.chinese: 漢王聞之，袒而大哭。
translations.literal: The King of Han heard this, bared his torso, and wept loudly.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Han heard this, bared his chest in mourning, and wailed loudly.

context.previous: 新城三老董公遮說漢王以義帝死故。
context.next: 遂為義帝發喪，臨三日。

translations.chinese: 遂為義帝發喪，臨三日。
translations.literal: He then announced mourning for the Righteous Emperor and mourned for three days.
translations.idiomatic: He then proclaimed mourning rites for the Righteous Emperor and observed three days of mourning.

context.previous: 漢王聞之，袒而大哭。
context.next: 發使者告諸侯曰：「天下共立義帝，北面事之。

translations.chinese: 發使者告諸侯曰：「天下共立義帝，北面事之。
translations.literal: He sent envoys to inform the feudal lords, saying: "All under Heaven together installed the Righteous Emperor and faced north to serve him.
translations.idiomatic: He sent envoys to inform the feudal lords, saying: 'All under Heaven together installed the Righteous Emperor and faced north to serve him.'

context.previous: 遂為義帝發喪，臨三日。
context.next: 今項羽放殺義帝於江南，大逆無道。

translations.chinese: 今項羽放殺義帝於江南，大逆無道。
translations.literal: Now Xiang Yu has banished and killed the Righteous Emperor south of the Yangtze—this is great rebellion and lawlessness.
translations.idiomatic: Now Xiang Yu has banished and killed the Righteous Emperor south of the Yangtze—this is great rebellion and lawlessness.''

context.previous: 發使者告諸侯曰：「天下共立義帝，北面事之。
context.next: 寡人親為發喪，諸侯皆縞素。

translations.chinese: 寡人親為發喪，諸侯皆縞素。
translations.literal: I personally have announced mourning; may all the feudal lords wear white mourning garments.
translations.idiomatic: I personally have announced mourning; may all the feudal lords wear white mourning garments.''

context.previous: 今項羽放殺義帝於江南，大逆無道。
context.next: 悉發關內兵，收三河士，南浮江漢以下，願從諸侯王擊楚之殺義帝者。」

translations.chinese: 悉發關內兵，收三河士，南浮江漢以下，願從諸侯王擊楚之殺義帝者。」
translations.literal: Mobilize all troops within the passes, gather the gentlemen of the Three Rivers, float south down the Yangtze and Han rivers; I wish to follow the feudal lord kings to strike those of Chu who killed the Righteous Emperor."
translations.idiomatic: Mobilize all troops within the passes, gather the gentlemen of the Three Rivers, float south down the Yangtze and Han rivers. I wish to follow the feudal lord kings to strike those of Chu who killed the Righteous Emperor.''

context.previous: 寡人親為發喪，諸侯皆縞素。

translations.chinese: 是時項王北擊齊，田榮與戰城陽。
translations.literal: At this time King Xiang was attacking Qi to the north; Tian Rong fought with him at Chengyang.
translations.idiomatic: At this time King Xiang was attacking Qi to the north. Tian Rong fought with him at Chengyang.

context.next: 田榮敗，走平原，平原民殺之。

translations.chinese: 田榮敗，走平原，平原民殺之。
translations.literal: Tian Rong was defeated and fled to Pingyuan; the people of Pingyuan killed him.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Rong was defeated and fled to Pingyuan. The people of Pingyuan killed him.

context.previous: 是時項王北擊齊，田榮與戰城陽。
context.next: 齊皆降楚。

translations.chinese: 齊皆降楚。
translations.literal: All of Qi surrendered to Chu.
translations.idiomatic: All of Qi submitted to Chu.

context.previous: 田榮敗，走平原，平原民殺之。
context.next: 楚因焚燒其城郭，系虜其子女。

translations.chinese: 楚因焚燒其城郭，系虜其子女。
translations.literal: Chu consequently burned their city walls and took their sons and daughters as captives.
translations.idiomatic: Chu then burned their cities to the ground and carried off their children as captives.

context.previous: 齊皆降楚。
context.next: 齊人叛之。

translations.chinese: 齊人叛之。
translations.literal: The Qi people rebelled against them.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Qi rose up against them.

context.previous: 楚因焚燒其城郭，系虜其子女。
context.next: 田榮弟橫立榮子廣為齊王，齊王反楚城陽。

translations.chinese: 田榮弟橫立榮子廣為齊王，齊王反楚城陽。
translations.literal: Tian Rong's younger brother Heng installed Rong's son Guang as King of Qi; the King of Qi rebelled against Chu at Chengyang.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Rong's younger brother Heng installed Rong's son Guang as King of Qi. The King of Qi rebelled against Chu at Chengyang.

context.previous: 齊人叛之。
context.next: 項羽雖聞漢東，既已連齊兵，欲遂破之而擊漢。

translations.chinese: 項羽雖聞漢東，既已連齊兵，欲遂破之而擊漢。
translations.literal: Though Xiang Yu heard Han had gone east, having already engaged Qi's troops, he wished to completely break them before striking Han.
translations.idiomatic: Though Xiang Yu heard that Han had gone east, he was already engaged with Qi's forces and wanted to finish them off before turning on Han.

context.previous: 田榮弟橫立榮子廣為齊王，齊王反楚城陽。
context.next: 漢王以故得劫五諸侯兵，遂入彭城。

translations.chinese: 漢王以故得劫五諸侯兵，遂入彭城。
translations.literal: The King of Han because of this was able to coerce the troops of five feudal lords and then entered Pengcheng.
translations.idiomatic: Thanks to this development, the King of Han was able to commandeer the armies of five feudal lords and marched into Pengcheng.

context.previous: 項羽雖聞漢東，既已連齊兵，欲遂破之而擊漢。
context.next: 項羽聞之，乃引兵去齊，從魯出胡陵，至蕭，與漢大戰彭城靈壁東睢水上，大破漢軍，多殺士卒，睢水為之不流。

translations.chinese: 項羽聞之，乃引兵去齊，從魯出胡陵，至蕭，與漢大戰彭城靈壁東睢水上，大破漢軍，多殺士卒，睢水為之不流。
translations.literal: Xiang Yu heard of this and led his troops away from Qi, came out from Lu through Huling, reached Xiao, and fought a great battle with Han at Pengcheng, east of Lingbi on the Sui River, greatly breaking the Han army, killing many officers and troops—the Sui River stopped flowing because of them.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu heard of this and led his troops away from Qi. He came out from Lu through Huling, reached Xiao, and fought a great battle with Han at Pengcheng, east of Lingbi on the Sui River. He greatly broke the Han army, killing many officers and troops—the Sui River stopped flowing because of them.

context.previous: 漢王以故得劫五諸侯兵，遂入彭城。
context.next: 乃取漢王父母妻子於沛，置之軍中以為質。

translations.chinese: 乃取漢王父母妻子於沛，置之軍中以為質。
translations.literal: He then took the King of Han's father, mother, wife, and children at Pei and placed them in the army as hostages.
translations.idiomatic: He then seized the King of Han's parents and family from Pei and held them in the army camp as hostages.

context.previous: 項羽聞之，乃引兵去齊，從魯出胡陵，至蕭，與漢大戰彭城靈壁東睢水上，大破漢軍，多殺士卒，睢水為之不流。
context.next: 當是時，諸侯見楚彊漢敗，還皆去漢復為楚。

translations.chinese: 當是時，諸侯見楚彊漢敗，還皆去漢復為楚。
translations.literal: At that time, the feudal lords saw Chu was strong and Han defeated; they all turned away from Han and again became Chu.
translations.idiomatic: At that time, the feudal lords saw Chu was strong and Han defeated. They all turned away from Han and again became Chu.

context.previous: 乃取漢王父母妻子於沛，置之軍中以為質。
context.next: 塞王欣亡入楚。

translations.chinese: 塞王欣亡入楚。
translations.literal: King Xin of Sai fled and entered Chu.
translations.idiomatic: King Xin of Sai fled into Chu territory.

context.previous: 當是時，諸侯見楚彊漢敗，還皆去漢復為楚。

translations.chinese: 呂后兄周呂侯為漢將兵，居下邑。
translations.literal: Empress Lü's elder brother Lord Zhou Lü commanded Han troops, stationed at Xiayi.
translations.idiomatic: Empress Lü's elder brother, Lord Zhou Lü, commanded Han troops stationed at Xiayi.

context.next: 漢王從之，稍收士卒，軍碭。

translations.chinese: 漢王從之，稍收士卒，軍碭。
translations.literal: The King of Han joined him and gradually gathered officers and troops, encamping at Dang.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Han joined him and gradually rallied soldiers and officers, making camp at Dang.

context.previous: 呂后兄周呂侯為漢將兵，居下邑。
context.next: 漢王乃西過梁地，至虞。

translations.chinese: 漢王乃西過梁地，至虞。
translations.literal: The King of Han then went west through the land of Liang and reached Yu.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Han then marched west through Liang territory and reached Yu.

context.previous: 漢王從之，稍收士卒，軍碭。
context.next: 使謁者隨何之九江王布所，曰：「公能令布舉兵叛楚，項羽必留擊之。

translations.chinese: 使謁者隨何之九江王布所，曰：「公能令布舉兵叛楚，項羽必留擊之。
translations.literal: He sent the herald Sui He to the King of Jiujiang Bu's location, saying: "If you can make Bu raise troops and rebel against Chu, Xiang Yu will certainly remain to strike him.
translations.idiomatic: He sent the herald Sui He to the King of Jiujiang Bu's location, saying: 'If you can make Bu raise troops and rebel against Chu, Xiang Yu will certainly remain to strike him.'

context.previous: 漢王乃西過梁地，至虞。
context.next: 得留數月，吾取天下必矣。」

translations.chinese: 得留數月，吾取天下必矣。」
translations.literal: If we can keep him there for several months, my taking of all under Heaven is certain."
translations.idiomatic: If we can keep him there for several months, my taking of all under Heaven is certain.''

context.previous: 使謁者隨何之九江王布所，曰：「公能令布舉兵叛楚，項羽必留擊之。
context.next: 隨何往說九江王布，布果背楚。

translations.chinese: 隨何往說九江王布，布果背楚。
translations.literal: Sui He went and persuaded King Bu of Jiujiang; Bu indeed turned his back on Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Sui He went and persuaded King Bu of Jiujiang. Bu indeed turned his back on Chu.

context.previous: 得留數月，吾取天下必矣。」
context.next: 楚使龍且往擊之。

translations.chinese: 楚使龍且往擊之。
translations.literal: Chu sent Long Ju to strike him.
translations.idiomatic: Chu dispatched Long Ju to attack him.

context.previous: 隨何往說九江王布，布果背楚。

translations.chinese: 漢王之敗彭城而西，行使人求家室，家室亦亡，不相得。
translations.literal: When the King of Han was defeated at Pengcheng and went west, he sent people on the road to seek his family, but his family had also disappeared and they could not find each other.
translations.idiomatic: When the King of Han was defeated at Pengcheng and went west, he sent people on the road to seek his family. But his family had also disappeared and they could not find each other.

context.next: 敗後乃獨得孝惠，六月，立為太子，大赦罪人。

translations.chinese: 敗後乃獨得孝惠，六月，立為太子，大赦罪人。
translations.literal: After the defeat he alone found Xiaohui; in the sixth month, he installed him as Crown Prince and granted a great amnesty to criminals.
translations.idiomatic: After the defeat he alone found Xiaohui. In the sixth month, he installed him as Crown Prince and granted a great amnesty to criminals.

context.previous: 漢王之敗彭城而西，行使人求家室，家室亦亡，不相得。
context.next: 令太子守櫟陽，諸侯子在關中者皆集櫟陽為衛。

translations.chinese: 令太子守櫟陽，諸侯子在關中者皆集櫟陽為衛。
translations.literal: He ordered the Crown Prince to defend Liyang; all sons of feudal lords who were in Guanzhong assembled at Liyang to serve as guards.
translations.idiomatic: He ordered the Crown Prince to defend Liyang. All sons of feudal lords who were in Guanzhong assembled at Liyang to serve as guards.

context.previous: 敗後乃獨得孝惠，六月，立為太子，大赦罪人。
context.next: 引水灌廢丘，廢丘降，章邯自殺。

translations.chinese: 引水灌廢丘，廢丘降，章邯自殺。
translations.literal: They diverted water to flood Feiqiu; Feiqiu surrendered and Zhang Han committed suicide.
translations.idiomatic: They diverted water to flood Feiqiu. Feiqiu surrendered and Zhang Han committed suicide.

context.previous: 令太子守櫟陽，諸侯子在關中者皆集櫟陽為衛。
context.next: 更名廢丘為槐里。

translations.chinese: 更名廢丘為槐里。
translations.literal: They renamed Feiqiu as Huaili.
translations.idiomatic: They renamed Feiqiu to Huaili.

context.previous: 引水灌廢丘，廢丘降，章邯自殺。
context.next: 於是令祠官祀天地四方上帝山川，以時祀之。

translations.chinese: 於是令祠官祀天地四方上帝山川，以時祀之。
translations.literal: Thereupon he ordered the sacrificial officials to make offerings to Heaven, Earth, the Four Directions, the Supreme Deity, mountains, and rivers, sacrificing to them at the proper times.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon he ordered the sacrificial officials to perform rites to Heaven, Earth, the Four Quarters, the Supreme Deity, mountains, and rivers at the appropriate seasons.

context.previous: 更名廢丘為槐里。
context.next: 興關內卒乘塞。

translations.chinese: 興關內卒乘塞。
translations.literal: He mobilized troops from within the passes to man the fortifications.
translations.idiomatic: He raised troops from within the passes to garrison the defenses.

context.previous: 於是令祠官祀天地四方上帝山川，以時祀之。

translations.chinese: 是時九江王布與龍且戰，不勝，與隨何閒行歸漢。
translations.literal: At this time King Bu of Jiujiang fought with Long Ju, did not win, and traveled secretly with Sui He to return to Han.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, King Bu of Jiujiang battled Long Ju but was defeated, and secretly slipped away with Sui He to return to Han.

context.next: 漢王稍收士卒，與諸將及關中卒益出，是以兵大振滎陽，破楚京、索閒。

translations.chinese: 漢王稍收士卒，與諸將及關中卒益出，是以兵大振滎陽，破楚京、索閒。
translations.literal: The King of Han gradually gathered officers and troops; together with the various generals and troops from within the passes they increasingly came out, so that the troops greatly rallied at Yingyang and broke Chu between Jing and Suo.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Han gradually gathered officers and troops. Together with the various generals and troops from within the passes they increasingly came out. So that the troops greatly rallied at Yingyang and broke Chu between Jing and Suo.

context.previous: 是時九江王布與龍且戰，不勝，與隨何閒行歸漢。

translations.chinese: 三年，魏王豹謁歸視親疾，至即絕河津，反為楚。
translations.literal: In the third year, King Bao of Wei requested leave to return to visit his ailing relatives; when he arrived he immediately cut off the Yellow River ford and rebelled to become Chu.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, King Bao of Wei requested leave to return to visit his ailing relatives. When he arrived he immediately cut off the Yellow River ford and rebelled to become Chu.

context.next: 漢王使酈生說豹，豹不聽。

translations.chinese: 漢王使酈生說豹，豹不聽。
translations.literal: The King of Han sent Li Sheng to persuade Bao, but Bao would not listen.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Han sent Li Sheng to try to persuade Bao, but Bao refused to listen.

context.previous: 三年，魏王豹謁歸視親疾，至即絕河津，反為楚。
context.next: 漢王遣將軍韓信擊，大破之，虜豹。

translations.chinese: 漢王遣將軍韓信擊，大破之，虜豹。
translations.literal: The King of Han dispatched General Han Xin to strike, greatly broke him, and captured Bao.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Han dispatched General Han Xin to strike. He greatly broke him and captured Bao.

context.previous: 漢王使酈生說豹，豹不聽。
context.next: 遂定魏地，置三郡，曰河東、太原、上黨。

translations.chinese: 遂定魏地，置三郡，曰河東、太原、上黨。
translations.literal: They then settled the territory of Wei, establishing three commanderies: Hedong, Taiyuan, and Shangdang.
translations.idiomatic: They then pacified Wei territory and established three commanderies: Hedong, Taiyuan, and Shangdang.

context.previous: 漢王遣將軍韓信擊，大破之，虜豹。
context.next: 漢王乃令張耳與韓信遂東下井陘擊趙，斬陳餘、趙王歇。

translations.chinese: 漢王乃令張耳與韓信遂東下井陘擊趙，斬陳餘、趙王歇。
translations.literal: The King of Han then ordered Zhang Er and Han Xin to proceed east down Jingxing to strike Zhao, behead Chen Yu and King Xie of Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Han then ordered Zhang Er and Han Xin to proceed east down Jingxing to strike Zhao. They beheaded Chen Yu and King Xie of Zhao.

context.previous: 遂定魏地，置三郡，曰河東、太原、上黨。
context.next: 其明年，立張耳為趙王。

translations.chinese: 其明年，立張耳為趙王。
translations.literal: The next year, he installed Zhang Er as King of Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: The following year, he installed Zhang Er as King of Zhao.

context.previous: 漢王乃令張耳與韓信遂東下井陘擊趙，斬陳餘、趙王歇。

translations.chinese: 漢王軍滎陽南，筑甬道屬之河，以取敖倉。
translations.literal: The King of Han's army was south of Yingyang, constructing a walled supply road connecting it to the river to obtain grain from Ao Granary.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Han's army camped south of Yingyang and built a covered causeway connecting to the river to access the grain stores at Ao Granary.

context.next: 與項羽相距歲餘。

translations.chinese: 與項羽相距歲餘。
translations.literal: They confronted Xiang Yu for over a year.
translations.idiomatic: They faced off against Xiang Yu for more than a year.

context.previous: 漢王軍滎陽南，筑甬道屬之河，以取敖倉。
context.next: 項羽數侵奪漢甬道，漢軍乏食，遂圍漢王。

translations.chinese: 項羽數侵奪漢甬道，漢軍乏食，遂圍漢王。
translations.literal: Xiang Yu repeatedly raided and seized Han's supply road; the Han army lacked food and was then besieged by the King of Han.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu repeatedly raided and seized Han's supply road. The Han army lacked food and was then besieged.

context.previous: 與項羽相距歲餘。
context.next: 漢王請和，割滎陽以西者為漢。

translations.chinese: 漢王請和，割滎陽以西者為漢。
translations.literal: The King of Han requested peace, offering to cede Yingyang and westward as Han.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Han sued for peace, offering to cede everything west of Yingyang to Han.

context.previous: 項羽數侵奪漢甬道，漢軍乏食，遂圍漢王。
context.next: 項王不聽。

translations.chinese: 項王不聽。
translations.literal: King Xiang would not listen.
translations.idiomatic: King Xiang refused to listen.

context.previous: 漢王請和，割滎陽以西者為漢。
context.next: 漢王患之，乃用陳平之計，予陳平金四萬斤，以閒疏楚君臣。

translations.chinese: 漢王患之，乃用陳平之計，予陳平金四萬斤，以閒疏楚君臣。
translations.literal: The King of Han was troubled by this, so he used Chen Ping's stratagem, giving Chen Ping forty thousand jin of gold to sow discord between Chu's lord and ministers.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Han was troubled by this, so he used Chen Ping's stratagem. He gave Chen Ping forty thousand jin of gold to sow discord between Chu's lord and ministers.

context.previous: 項王不聽。
context.next: 於是項羽乃疑亞父。

translations.chinese: 於是項羽乃疑亞父。
translations.literal: Thereupon Xiang Yu became suspicious of the Second Father.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon Xiang Yu grew suspicious of Fan Zeng.

context.previous: 漢王患之，乃用陳平之計，予陳平金四萬斤，以閒疏楚君臣。
context.next: 亞父是時勸項羽遂下滎陽，及其見疑，乃怒，辭老，願賜骸骨歸卒伍，未至彭城而死。

translations.chinese: 亞父是時勸項羽遂下滎陽，及其見疑，乃怒，辭老，願賜骸骨歸卒伍，未至彭城而死。
translations.literal: At that time the Second Father urged Xiang Yu to take Yingyang; when he saw himself suspected, he became angry, pleaded old age, requested to be granted his aged bones to return to the ranks; he died before reaching Pengcheng.
translations.idiomatic: At that time the Second Father urged Xiang Yu to take Yingyang. When he saw himself suspected, he became angry, pleaded old age, and requested to be granted his aged bones to return to the ranks. He died before reaching Pengcheng.

context.previous: 於是項羽乃疑亞父。

translations.chinese: 漢軍絕食，乃夜出女子東門二千餘人，被甲，楚因四面擊之。
translations.literal: The Han army was cut off from food, so by night they sent out over two thousand women from the east gate wearing armor; Chu consequently attacked them from four sides.
translations.idiomatic: The Han army was cut off from food, so by night they sent out over two thousand women from the east gate wearing armor. Chu consequently attacked them from four sides.

context.next: 將軍紀信乃乘王駕，詐為漢王，誑楚，楚皆呼萬歲，之城東觀，以故漢王得與數十騎出西門遁。

translations.chinese: 將軍紀信乃乘王駕，詐為漢王，誑楚，楚皆呼萬歲，之城東觀，以故漢王得與數十騎出西門遁。
translations.literal: General Ji Xin then rode in the king's chariot, pretended to be the King of Han, and deceived Chu; all the Chu troops shouted 'Long live!' and went to observe east of the city; because of this the King of Han was able to escape out the west gate with several tens of riders.
translations.idiomatic: General Ji Xin then rode in the king's chariot, pretended to be the King of Han, and deceived Chu. All the Chu troops shouted 'Long live!' and went to observe east of the city. Because of this the King of Han was able to escape out the west gate with several tens of riders.

context.previous: 漢軍絕食，乃夜出女子東門二千餘人，被甲，楚因四面擊之。
context.next: 令御史大夫周苛、魏豹、樅公守滎陽。

translations.chinese: 令御史大夫周苛、魏豹、樅公守滎陽。
translations.literal: He ordered Imperial Secretary Zhou Ke, Wei Bao, and Duke Cong to defend Yingyang.
translations.idiomatic: He ordered Imperial Secretary Zhou Ke, Wei Bao, and Duke Cong to defend Yingyang.

context.previous: 將軍紀信乃乘王駕，詐為漢王，誑楚，楚皆呼萬歲，之城東觀，以故漢王得與數十騎出西門遁。
context.next: 諸將卒不能從者，盡在城中。

translations.chinese: 諸將卒不能從者，盡在城中。
translations.literal: All generals and troops who could not follow were entirely in the city.
translations.idiomatic: All the generals and soldiers who couldn't follow him were left behind in the city.

context.previous: 令御史大夫周苛、魏豹、樅公守滎陽。
context.next: 周苛、樅公相謂曰：「反國之王，難與守城。」

translations.chinese: 周苛、樅公相謂曰：「反國之王，難與守城。」
translations.literal: Zhou Ke and Duke Cong said to each other: "A king who has rebelled against his state is difficult to defend a city with."
translations.idiomatic: Zhou Ke and Duke Cong said to each other: 'A king who has rebelled against his state is difficult to defend a city with.''

context.previous: 諸將卒不能從者，盡在城中。
context.next: 因殺魏豹。

translations.chinese: 因殺魏豹。
translations.literal: They consequently killed Wei Bao.
translations.idiomatic: They consequently executed Wei Bao.

context.previous: 周苛、樅公相謂曰：「反國之王，難與守城。」

translations.chinese: 漢王之出滎陽入關，收兵欲復東。
translations.literal: When the King of Han left Yingyang and entered the passes, he gathered troops wishing to go east again.
translations.idiomatic: When the King of Han left Yingyang and entered the passes, he rallied troops intending to march east again.

context.next: 袁生說漢王曰：「漢與楚相距滎陽數歲，漢常困。

translations.chinese: 袁生說漢王曰：「漢與楚相距滎陽數歲，漢常困。
translations.literal: Yuan Sheng persuaded the King of Han, saying: "Han and Chu have confronted each other at Yingyang for several years; Han has constantly been in difficulty.
translations.idiomatic: Yuan Sheng persuaded the King of Han, saying: 'Han and Chu have confronted each other at Yingyang for several years. Han has constantly been in difficulty.'

context.previous: 漢王之出滎陽入關，收兵欲復東。
context.next: 願君王出武關，項羽必引兵南走，王深壁，令滎陽成皋閒且得休。

translations.chinese: 願君王出武關，項羽必引兵南走，王深壁，令滎陽成皋閒且得休。
translations.literal: I hope the king will go out through Wuguan; Xiang Yu will certainly lead troops south in pursuit; the king should entrench deeply, allowing those between Yingyang and Chenggao to obtain some rest.
translations.idiomatic: I hope the king will go out through Wuguan. Xiang Yu will certainly lead troops south in pursuit. The king should entrench deeply, allowing those between Yingyang and Chenggao to obtain some rest.

context.previous: 袁生說漢王曰：「漢與楚相距滎陽數歲，漢常困。
context.next: 使韓信等輯河北趙地，連燕齊，君王乃復走滎陽，未晚也。

translations.chinese: 使韓信等輯河北趙地，連燕齊，君王乃復走滎陽，未晚也。
translations.literal: Have Han Xin and others pacify the territory of Zhao north of the Yellow River, connect with Yan and Qi, then the king can return to Yingyang—it will not be too late.
translations.idiomatic: Have Han Xin and others pacify the territory of Zhao north of the Yellow River, connect with Yan and Qi. Then the king can return to Yingyang—it will not be too late.

context.previous: 願君王出武關，項羽必引兵南走，王深壁，令滎陽成皋閒且得休。
context.next: 如此，則楚所備者多，力分，漢得休，復與之戰，破楚必矣。」

translations.chinese: 如此，則楚所備者多，力分，漢得休，復與之戰，破楚必矣。」
translations.literal: If this is done, then what Chu must prepare for will be many places, their strength divided; Han will obtain rest and fight with them again—breaking Chu will be certain."
translations.idiomatic: If this is done, then what Chu must prepare for will be many places, their strength divided. Han will obtain rest and fight with them again—breaking Chu will be certain.''

context.previous: 使韓信等輯河北趙地，連燕齊，君王乃復走滎陽，未晚也。
context.next: 漢王從其計，出軍宛葉閒，與黥布行收兵。

translations.chinese: 漢王從其計，出軍宛葉閒，與黥布行收兵。
translations.literal: The King of Han followed his plan, sent out his army between Wan and Ye, and traveled with Qing Bu gathering troops.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Han adopted his strategy, deployed his army between Wan and Ye, and traveled with Qing Bu recruiting troops.

context.previous: 如此，則楚所備者多，力分，漢得休，復與之戰，破楚必矣。」

translations.chinese: 項羽聞漢王在宛，果引兵南。
translations.literal: Xiang Yu heard the King of Han was at Wan and indeed led troops south.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu learned that the King of Han was at Wan and immediately marched south.

context.next: 漢王堅壁不與戰。

translations.chinese: 漢王堅壁不與戰。
translations.literal: The King of Han entrenched firmly and would not engage in battle.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Han fortified his position and refused battle.

context.previous: 項羽聞漢王在宛，果引兵南。
context.next: 是時彭越渡睢水，與項聲、薛公戰下邳，彭越大破楚軍。

translations.chinese: 是時彭越渡睢水，與項聲、薛公戰下邳，彭越大破楚軍。
translations.literal: At this time Peng Yue crossed the Sui River and fought with Xiang Sheng and Xue Gong at Xiapei; Peng Yue greatly broke the Chu army.
translations.idiomatic: At this time Peng Yue crossed the Sui River and fought with Xiang Sheng and Xue Gong at Xiapei. Peng Yue greatly broke the Chu army.

context.previous: 漢王堅壁不與戰。
context.next: 項羽乃引兵東擊彭越。

translations.chinese: 項羽乃引兵東擊彭越。
translations.literal: Xiang Yu then led troops east to strike Peng Yue.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu then marched east to attack Peng Yue.

context.previous: 是時彭越渡睢水，與項聲、薛公戰下邳，彭越大破楚軍。
context.next: 漢王亦引兵北軍成皋。

translations.chinese: 漢王亦引兵北軍成皋。
translations.literal: The King of Han also led troops north to encamp at Chenggao.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Han also marched north and made camp at Chenggao.

context.previous: 項羽乃引兵東擊彭越。
context.next: 項羽已破走彭越，聞漢王復軍成皋，乃復引兵西，拔滎陽，誅周苛、樅公，而虜韓王信，遂圍成皋。

translations.chinese: 項羽已破走彭越，聞漢王復軍成皋，乃復引兵西，拔滎陽，誅周苛、樅公，而虜韓王信，遂圍成皋。
translations.literal: Having broken and driven off Peng Yue, Xiang Yu heard the King of Han had again encamped at Chenggao, so he again led troops west, took Yingyang, executed Zhou Ke and Duke Cong, captured King Xin of Han as prisoner, and then besieged Chenggao.
translations.idiomatic: Having broken and driven off Peng Yue, Xiang Yu heard the King of Han had again encamped at Chenggao. So he again led troops west, took Yingyang, executed Zhou Ke and Duke Cong, captured King Xin of Han as prisoner, and then besieged Chenggao.

context.previous: 漢王亦引兵北軍成皋。

translations.chinese: 漢王跳，獨與滕公共車出成皋玉門，北渡河，馳宿修武。
translations.literal: The King of Han leaped out, alone with Duke Teng sharing a chariot going out Chenggao's Jade Gate, crossed the Yellow River to the north, and galloped to lodge at Xiuwu.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Han leaped out, alone with Duke Teng sharing a chariot going out Chenggao's Jade Gate. He crossed the Yellow River to the north and galloped to lodge at Xiuwu.

context.next: 自稱使者，晨馳入張耳、韓信壁，而奪之軍。

translations.chinese: 自稱使者，晨馳入張耳、韓信壁，而奪之軍。
translations.literal: Calling himself an envoy, at dawn he galloped into Zhang Er and Han Xin's encampment and seized their army.
translations.idiomatic: Claiming to be an envoy, he charged at dawn into Zhang Er and Han Xin's camp and took command of their army.

context.previous: 漢王跳，獨與滕公共車出成皋玉門，北渡河，馳宿修武。
context.next: 乃使張耳北益收兵趙地，使韓信東擊齊。

translations.chinese: 乃使張耳北益收兵趙地，使韓信東擊齊。
translations.literal: He then sent Zhang Er north to further gather troops in Zhao territory and sent Han Xin east to strike Qi.
translations.idiomatic: He sent Zhang Er north to recruit more troops in Zhao territory and Han Xin east to attack Qi.

context.previous: 自稱使者，晨馳入張耳、韓信壁，而奪之軍。
context.next: 漢王得韓信軍，則復振。

translations.chinese: 漢王得韓信軍，則復振。
translations.literal: The King of Han having obtained Han Xin's army then rallied again.
translations.idiomatic: With Han Xin's army now under his command, the King of Han regained his strength.

context.previous: 乃使張耳北益收兵趙地，使韓信東擊齊。
context.next: 引兵臨河，南饗軍小修武南，欲復戰。

translations.chinese: 引兵臨河，南饗軍小修武南，欲復戰。
translations.literal: He led troops to the Yellow River, feasted the army to the south at Little Xiuwu to the south, wishing to fight again.
translations.idiomatic: He led troops to the Yellow River, feasted the army to the south at Little Xiuwu, wishing to fight again.

context.previous: 漢王得韓信軍，則復振。
context.next: 郎中鄭忠乃說止漢王，使高壘深塹，勿與戰。

translations.chinese: 郎中鄭忠乃說止漢王，使高壘深塹，勿與戰。
translations.literal: Gentleman Zheng Zhong then persuaded and stopped the King of Han, having him build high ramparts and dig deep trenches and not engage in battle.
translations.idiomatic: Gentleman Zheng Zhong then persuaded the King of Han to hold back, building high fortifications and deep trenches instead of giving battle.

context.previous: 引兵臨河，南饗軍小修武南，欲復戰。
context.next: 漢王聽其計，使盧綰、劉賈將卒二萬人，騎數百，渡白馬津，入楚地，與彭越復擊破楚軍燕郭西，遂復下梁地十餘城。

translations.chinese: 漢王聽其計，使盧綰、劉賈將卒二萬人，騎數百，渡白馬津，入楚地，與彭越復擊破楚軍燕郭西，遂復下梁地十餘城。
translations.literal: The Han king listened to their plan, sent Lu Wan and Liu Jia to lead twenty thousand troops and several hundred cavalry, cross the Bai Ma ford, enter Chu territory, and together with Peng Yue again strike and break Chu army at Yan Guo west, then recapture over ten Liang cities.
translations.idiomatic: The Han king listened to their plan, sent Lu Wan and Liu Jia to lead twenty thousand troops and several hundred cavalry. They crossed the Bai Ma ford, entered Chu territory, and together with Peng Yue again struck and broke Chu army at Yan Guo west, then recaptured over ten Liang cities.

context.previous: 郎中鄭忠乃說止漢王，使高壘深塹，勿與戰。

translations.chinese: 淮陰已受命東，未渡平原。
translations.literal: Marquis of Huaiyin already received orders east, not yet crossed Pingyuan.
translations.idiomatic: The Marquis of Huaiyin had already received orders to go east but had not yet crossed Pingyuan.

context.next: 漢王使酈生往說齊王田廣，廣叛楚，與漢和，共擊項羽。

translations.chinese: 漢王使酈生往說齊王田廣，廣叛楚，與漢和，共擊項羽。
translations.literal: The King of Han sent Li Sheng to persuade King Tian Guang of Qi; Guang rebelled against Chu and made peace with Han to together strike Xiang Yu.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Han sent Li Sheng to persuade King Tian Guang of Qi. Guang rebelled against Chu and made peace with Han to together strike Xiang Yu.

context.previous: 淮陰已受命東，未渡平原。
context.next: 韓信用蒯通計，遂襲破齊。

translations.chinese: 韓信用蒯通計，遂襲破齊。
translations.literal: Han Xin used Kuai Tong's stratagem and then launched a surprise attack and broke Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Han Xin followed Kuai Tong's strategy and launched a surprise attack that shattered Qi.

context.previous: 漢王使酈生往說齊王田廣，廣叛楚，與漢和，共擊項羽。
context.next: 齊王烹酈生，東走高密。

translations.chinese: 齊王烹酈生，東走高密。
translations.literal: The King of Qi boiled Li Sheng alive and fled east to Gaomi.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Qi had Li Sheng boiled alive and fled east to Gaomi.

context.previous: 韓信用蒯通計，遂襲破齊。
context.next: 項羽聞韓信已舉河北兵破齊、趙，且欲擊楚，則使龍且、周蘭往擊之。

translations.chinese: 項羽聞韓信已舉河北兵破齊、趙，且欲擊楚，則使龍且、周蘭往擊之。
translations.literal: Xiang Yu heard that Han Xin had already raised troops north of the Yellow River and broken Qi and Zhao and was about to strike Chu, so he sent Long Ju and Zhou Lan to strike him.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu heard that Han Xin had already raised troops north of the Yellow River and broken Qi and Zhao and was about to strike Chu. So he sent Long Ju and Zhou Lan to strike him.

context.previous: 齊王烹酈生，東走高密。
context.next: 韓信與戰，騎將灌嬰擊，大破楚軍，殺龍且。

translations.chinese: 韓信與戰，騎將灌嬰擊，大破楚軍，殺龍且。
translations.literal: Han Xin engaged in battle; cavalry general Guan Ying struck and greatly broke the Chu army, killing Long Ju.
translations.idiomatic: Han Xin engaged in battle. Cavalry general Guan Ying struck and greatly broke the Chu army, killing Long Ju.

context.previous: 項羽聞韓信已舉河北兵破齊、趙，且欲擊楚，則使龍且、周蘭往擊之。
context.next: 齊王廣奔彭越。

translations.chinese: 齊王廣奔彭越。
translations.literal: King Guang of Qi fled to Peng Yue.
translations.idiomatic: King Guang of Qi fled to Peng Yue for refuge.

context.previous: 韓信與戰，騎將灌嬰擊，大破楚軍，殺龍且。
context.next: 當此時，彭越將兵居梁地，往來苦楚兵，絕其糧食。

translations.chinese: 當此時，彭越將兵居梁地，往來苦楚兵，絕其糧食。
translations.literal: At this time, Peng Yue led troops stationed in the land of Liang, traveling back and forth tormenting the Chu troops and cutting off their grain supply.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Peng Yue commanded troops based in Liang territory, constantly harassing the Chu forces and severing their supply lines.

context.previous: 齊王廣奔彭越。

translations.chinese: 四年，項羽乃謂海春侯大司馬曹咎曰：「謹守成皋。
translations.literal: In the fourth year, Xiang Yu then said to Marquis of Haichun Grand Marshal Cao Jiu: "Carefully defend Chenggao.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, Xiang Yu then said to Marquis of Haichun Grand Marshal Cao Jiu: 'Carefully defend Chenggao.'

context.next: 若漢挑戰，慎勿與戰，無令得東而已。

translations.chinese: 若漢挑戰，慎勿與戰，無令得東而已。
translations.literal: If Han challenges to battle, be cautious not to engage in battle, and do not let them get east—that is all.
translations.idiomatic: If Han challenges to battle, be cautious not to engage in battle, and do not let them get east—that is all.''

context.previous: 四年，項羽乃謂海春侯大司馬曹咎曰：「謹守成皋。

translations.idiomatic: Han indeed repeatedly challenged the Chu army to battle. The Chu army would not come out. They sent men to insult them for five or six days. The Grand Marshal was enraged and crossed his troops over the Fan River.

translations.idiomatic: When half the soldiers had crossed, Han attacked, routing the Chu army and seizing all their gold, jade, treasures, and valuables.

translations.idiomatic: Grand Marshal Jiu and Chief Clerk Xin both committed suicide by the Fan River.

translations.idiomatic: The Han army was besieging Zhongli Mo east of Yingyang. When Xiang Yu arrived, they all fled to dangerous terrain.

translations.literal: Han Xin having already broken Qi sent someone to say: "Qi borders Chu; authority is light—if I am not made provisional king, I fear I cannot stabilize Qi."
translations.idiomatic: Han Xin having already broken Qi sent someone to say: 'Qi borders Chu; authority is light—if I am not made provisional king, I fear I cannot stabilize Qi.''

translations.literal: The King of Han wished to attack him.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Han wanted to attack him.

translations.idiomatic: The Marquis of Liu said: 'It would be better to consequently install him and have him defend on his own.''

translations.idiomatic: He sent Zhang Liang with the royal seal and sashes to install Han Xin as King of Qi.

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu heard that Long Ju's army was broken and was then afraid. He sent Wu She of Xutai to persuade Han Xin.

context.next: 韓信不聽。

translations.literal: Han Xin would not listen.
translations.idiomatic: Han Xin refused.

translations.literal: Chu and Han long confronted each other without resolution; the able-bodied suffered from military service, the old and weak were exhausted transporting grain.
translations.idiomatic: Chu and Han long confronted each other without resolution. The able-bodied suffered from military service, the old and weak were exhausted transporting grain.

translations.literal: The King of Han and Xiang Yu faced each other between Guangwu and spoke.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Han and Xiang Yu stood facing each other across the Guangwu River and spoke.

translations.chinese: 項羽欲與漢王獨身挑戰。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu wanted to challenge the King of Han to personal combat.

translations.idiomatic: The King of Han enumerated Xiang Yu's crimes, saying: 'At first Xiang Yu and I both received orders from King Huai saying he who first enters and settles Guanzhong shall be its king. Xiang Yu broke the agreement and made me king in Shu and Han—crime one.'

context.previous: 項羽欲與漢王獨身挑戰。

translations.chinese: 秦項羽矯殺卿子冠軍而自尊，罪二。
translations.literal: Xiang Yu falsely killed Lord Superior to Ministers and exalted himself—crime two.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu falsely executed Lord Superior to Ministers and exalted himself—crime two.

context.previous: 漢王數項羽曰：「始與項羽俱受命懷王，曰先入定關中者王之，項羽負約，王我於蜀漢，罪一。
context.next: 項羽已救趙，當還報，而擅劫諸侯兵入關，罪三。

translations.chinese: 項羽已救趙，當還報，而擅劫諸侯兵入關，罪三。
translations.literal: Having already rescued Zhao, Xiang Yu should have returned to report, but instead he seized the feudal lords' troops without authorization and entered the passes—crime three.
translations.idiomatic: Having already rescued Zhao, Xiang Yu should have returned to report. But instead he seized the feudal lords' troops without authorization and entered the passes—crime three.

context.previous: 秦項羽矯殺卿子冠軍而自尊，罪二。

translations.chinese: 懷王約入秦無暴掠，項羽燒秦宮室，掘始皇帝冢，私收其財物，罪四。
translations.literal: King Huai's agreement was that in entering Qin there should be no violence or plunder; Xiang Yu burned the Qin palace chambers, dug up the First Emperor's tomb, and privately took its wealth and goods—crime four.
translations.idiomatic: King Huai's agreement was that in entering Qin there should be no violence or plunder. Xiang Yu burned the Qin palace chambers, dug up the First Emperor's tomb, and privately took its wealth and goods—crime four.

translations.literal: He also forcibly killed the surrendered King of Qin, Ziying—crime five.
translations.idiomatic: He also brutally murdered the surrendered King of Qin, Ziying—crime five.

context.previous: 懷王約入秦無暴掠，項羽燒秦宮室，掘始皇帝冢，私收其財物，罪四。

translations.chinese: 詐阬秦子弟新安二十萬，王其將，罪六。
translations.literal: He deceitfully buried alive two hundred thousand Qin sons and younger brothers at Xin'an and made their generals kings—crime six.
translations.idiomatic: He deceitfully massacred 200,000 Qin soldiers at Xin'an by burying them alive, then enfeoffed their generals—crime six.

context.previous: 又彊殺秦降王子嬰，罪五。

translations.literal: Xiang Yu made kings of all the generals in good lands while moving and expelling the former lords, causing ministers and subordinates to compete in rebellion and treason—crime seven.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu made kings of all the generals in good lands while moving and expelling the former lords. He caused ministers and subordinates to compete in rebellion and treason—crime seven.

context.previous: 詐阬秦子弟新安二十萬，王其將，罪六。

translations.literal: Xiang Yu expelled the Righteous Emperor from Pengcheng and made it his own capital, seized the King of Han's territory, and combined to rule Liang and Chu, taking much for himself—crime eight.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu expelled the Righteous Emperor from Pengcheng and made it his own capital. He seized the King of Han's territory and combined to rule Liang and Chu, taking much for himself—crime eight.

context.previous: 項羽皆王諸將善地，而徙逐故主，令臣下爭叛逆，罪七。

translations.literal: Xiang Yu sent men to secretly assassinate the Righteous Emperor south of the Yangtze—crime nine.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu sent assassins to murder the Righteous Emperor south of the Yangtze—crime nine.

translations.literal: Being a minister who assassinates his lord, kills those who have already surrendered, governs unjustly, does not keep agreements with his lord—these all under Heaven cannot tolerate; this is great rebellion and lawlessness—crime ten.
translations.idiomatic: Being a minister who assassinates his lord, kills those who have already surrendered, governs unjustly, does not keep agreements with his lord—these all under Heaven cannot tolerate. This is great rebellion and lawlessness—crime ten.

context.previous: 項羽使人陰弒義帝江南，罪九。

translations.literal: I with righteous troops follow the feudal lords to execute cruel rebels; I will have criminals with sentences of mutilation strike and kill Xiang Yu—why would I suffer to challenge you to combat!"
translations.idiomatic: I with righteous troops follow the feudal lords to execute cruel rebels. I will have criminals with sentences of mutilation strike and kill Xiang Yu—why would I suffer to challenge you to combat!''

context.previous: 夫為人臣而弒其主，殺已降，為政不平，主約不信，天下所不容，大逆無道，罪十也。

translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu greatly enraged, his hidden crossbow shot hit the King of Han.

translations.literal: The King of Han was wounded in the chest but grasped his foot and said: "The bandit hit my toe!"
translations.idiomatic: The King of Han was wounded in the chest but grasped his foot and said: 'The bandit hit my toe!''

translations.literal: The King of Han lay ill from the wound; Zhang Liang strongly requested the King of Han to rise and go comfort the army to reassure the officers and troops and not let Chu take advantage of Han.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Han lay ill from the wound. Zhang Liang strongly requested the King of Han to rise and go comfort the army to reassure the officers and troops and not let Chu take advantage of Han.

context.previous: 漢王傷匈，乃捫足曰：「虜中吾指！」

translations.idiomatic: The King of Han went out to tour the army. His illness was severe, so he galloped into Chenggao.

context.previous: 漢王病創臥，張良彊請漢王起行勞軍，以安士卒，毋令楚乘勝於漢。

translations.idiomatic: Once recovered, he marched west through the passes to Liyang, visited the elders, held a banquet, and had the former King of Sai Xin's head displayed in the marketplace.

translations.literal: He remained four days, then returned to the army and encamped at Guangwu.
translations.idiomatic: He stayed four days, then returned to his army and made camp at Guangwu.

context.previous: 病愈，西入關，至櫟陽，存問父老，置酒，梟故塞王欣頭櫟陽市。

translations.literal: Troops from within the passes increasingly came out.
translations.idiomatic: More troops kept emerging from within the passes.

context.previous: 留四日，復如軍，軍廣武。

translations.literal: At this time, Peng Yue led troops stationed in the land of Liang, traveling back and forth tormenting the Chu troops and cutting off their grain supply.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Peng Yue commanded troops based in Liang territory, constantly raiding Chu forces and severing their supply lines.

context.next: 田橫往從之。

translations.chinese: 田橫往從之。
translations.literal: Tian Heng went to join him.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Heng went to join his cause.

context.previous: 當此時，彭越將兵居梁地，往來苦楚兵，絕其糧食。

translations.chinese: 項羽數擊彭越等，齊王信又進擊楚。
translations.literal: Xiang Yu repeatedly struck Peng Yue and others; King Xin of Qi also advanced to strike Chu.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu repeatedly struck Peng Yue and others. King Xin of Qi also advanced to strike Chu.

context.previous: 田橫往從之。

translations.idiomatic: Terrified, Xiang Yu negotiated a truce with the King of Han, dividing the empire along the Hong Canal: west would be Han, east would be Chu.

translations.idiomatic: King Xiang returned the King of Han's father, mother, wife, and children. The army all shouted 'Long live!' They then returned and parted ways.

context.previous: 項羽恐，乃與漢王約，中分天下，割鴻溝而西者為漢，鴻溝而東者為楚。

translations.literal: Xiang Yu was released and returned eastward.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu was set free and headed back east.

translations.idiomatic: The King of Han wished to lead his troops and return westward, but using the plans of the Marquis of Liu and Chen Ping, he then advanced his troops to pursue Xiang Yu. context.previous: 項羽解而東歸。

translations.literal: Reaching Guling, they did not meet.
translations.idiomatic: When they reached Guling, the meeting never happened.

translations.literal: Chu struck the Han army and greatly broke them.

context.previous: 至固陵，不會。

translations.literal: The King of Han again entered his ramparts, dug deep trenches, and defended.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Han retreated behind his fortifications, dug deep trenches, and held his position.

context.previous: 楚擊漢軍，大破之。
