translations.literal: Using Zhang Liang's plan, thereupon Han Xin and Peng Yue both went.
translations.idiomatic: Following Zhang Liang's strategy, Han Xin and Peng Yue both arrived.

context.previous: 漢王復入壁，深塹而守之。
context.next: 及劉賈入楚地，圍壽春，漢王敗碧陵，乃使使者召大司馬周殷舉九江兵而迎（之）武王，行屠城父，隨（何）劉賈、齊梁諸侯皆大會垓下。

translations.chinese: 及劉賈入楚地，圍壽春，漢王敗碧陵，乃使使者召大司馬周殷舉九江兵而迎（之）武王，行屠城父，隨（何）劉賈、齊梁諸侯皆大會垓下。
translations.literal: When Liu Jia entered Chu territory and besieged Shouchun, the King of Han was defeated at Biling, so he sent envoys to summon Grand Marshal Zhou Yin to raise the troops of Jiujiang and welcome King Wu, marched and massacred Chengfu, following Liu Jia; the feudal lords of Qi and Liang all assembled in great numbers at Gaixia.
translations.idiomatic: When Liu Jia entered Chu territory and besieged Shouchun, the King of Han was defeated at Biling. So he sent envoys to summon Grand Marshal Zhou Yin to raise the troops of Jiujiang and welcome King Wu. He marched and massacred Chengfu, following Liu Jia. The feudal lords of Qi and Liang all assembled in great numbers at Gaixia.

context.previous: 用張良計，於是韓信、彭越皆往。
context.next: 立武王布為淮南王。

translations.chinese: 立武王布為淮南王。
translations.literal: He installed King Wu Bu as King of Huainan.
translations.idiomatic: He installed King Wu Bu as King of Huainan.

context.previous: 及劉賈入楚地，圍壽春，漢王敗碧陵，乃使使者召大司馬周殷舉九江兵而迎（之）武王，行屠城父，隨（何）劉賈、齊梁諸侯皆大會垓下。

translations.chinese: 五年，高祖與諸侯兵共擊楚軍，與項羽決勝垓下。
translations.literal: In the fifth year, Gao Zu together with the feudal lords' troops jointly struck the Chu army and decided victory with Xiang Yu at Gaixia.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, Gao Zu joined forces with the feudal lords to attack the Chu army and settle matters with Xiang Yu at Gaixia.

context.next: 淮陰侯將三十萬自當之，孔將軍居左，費將軍居右，皇帝在後，絳侯、柴將軍在皇帝後。

translations.chinese: 淮陰侯將三十萬自當之，孔將軍居左，費將軍居右，皇帝在後，絳侯、柴將軍在皇帝後。
translations.literal: The Marquis of Huaiyin led three hundred thousand and directly opposed them; General Kong was on the left, General Fei on the right, the Emperor behind, and Marquis of Jiang and General Chai behind the Emperor.
translations.idiomatic: The Marquis of Huaiyin led three hundred thousand and directly opposed them. General Kong was on the left, General Fei on the right, the Emperor behind, and Marquis of Jiang and General Chai behind the Emperor.

context.previous: 五年，高祖與諸侯兵共擊楚軍，與項羽決勝垓下。
context.next: 項羽之卒可十萬。

translations.chinese: 項羽之卒可十萬。
translations.literal: Xiang Yu's troops numbered about a hundred thousand.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu had around 100,000 troops.

context.previous: 淮陰侯將三十萬自當之，孔將軍居左，費將軍居右，皇帝在後，絳侯、柴將軍在皇帝後。
context.next: 淮陰先合，不利，卻。

translations.chinese: 淮陰先合，不利，卻。
translations.literal: Huaiyin first engaged, went unfavorably, and retreated.
translations.idiomatic: Huaiyin engaged first but fared poorly and withdrew.

context.previous: 項羽之卒可十萬。
context.next: 孔將軍、費將軍縱，楚兵不利，淮陰侯復乘之，大敗垓下。

translations.chinese: 孔將軍、費將軍縱，楚兵不利，淮陰侯復乘之，大敗垓下。
translations.literal: General Kong and General Fei were released; the Chu troops went unfavorably, and the Marquis of Huaiyin again rode upon them, greatly defeating them at Gaixia.
translations.idiomatic: General Kong and General Fei were released. The Chu troops went unfavorably, and the Marquis of Huaiyin again rode upon them, greatly defeating them at Gaixia.

context.previous: 淮陰先合，不利，卻。
context.next: 項羽卒聞漢軍之楚歌，以為漢盡得楚地，項羽乃敗而走，是以兵大敗。

translations.chinese: 項羽卒聞漢軍之楚歌，以為漢盡得楚地，項羽乃敗而走，是以兵大敗。
translations.literal: Xiang Yu's troops heard the Han army's Chu songs and thought Han had completely obtained the lands of Chu; Xiang Yu was then defeated and fled; because of this the troops were greatly defeated.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu's troops heard the Han army's Chu songs and thought Han had completely obtained the lands of Chu. Xiang Yu was then defeated and fled. Because of this the troops were greatly defeated.

context.previous: 孔將軍、費將軍縱，楚兵不利，淮陰侯復乘之，大敗垓下。
context.next: 使騎將灌嬰追殺項羽東城，斬首八萬，遂略定楚地。

translations.chinese: 使騎將灌嬰追殺項羽東城，斬首八萬，遂略定楚地。
translations.literal: He sent cavalry general Guan Ying to pursue and kill Xiang Yu at Dongcheng, behead eighty thousand, and then take and settle the lands of Chu.
translations.idiomatic: He sent cavalry general Guan Ying to pursue and kill Xiang Yu at Dongcheng, taking 80,000 heads, then conquered and pacified Chu territory.

context.previous: 項羽卒聞漢軍之楚歌，以為漢盡得楚地，項羽乃敗而走，是以兵大敗。
context.next: 魯為楚堅守不下。

translations.chinese: 魯為楚堅守不下。
translations.literal: Lu firmly defended for Chu and would not surrender.
translations.idiomatic: Lu held out staunchly for Chu and refused to surrender.

context.previous: 使騎將灌嬰追殺項羽東城，斬首八萬，遂略定楚地。
context.next: 漢王引諸侯兵北，示魯父老項羽頭，魯乃降。

translations.chinese: 漢王引諸侯兵北，示魯父老項羽頭，魯乃降。
translations.literal: The King of Han led the feudal lords' troops north and showed Xiang Yu's head to the fathers and elders of Lu; Lu then surrendered.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Han led the feudal lords' troops north and showed Xiang Yu's head to the fathers and elders of Lu. Lu then surrendered.

context.previous: 魯為楚堅守不下。
context.next: 遂以魯公號葬項羽穀城。

translations.chinese: 遂以魯公號葬項羽穀城。
translations.literal: They then buried Xiang Yu at Gucheng with the rites of Duke of Lu.
translations.idiomatic: They buried Xiang Yu at Gucheng with the honors due a Duke of Lu.

context.previous: 漢王引諸侯兵北，示魯父老項羽頭，魯乃降。
context.next: 還至定陶，馳入齊王壁，奪其軍。

translations.chinese: 還至定陶，馳入齊王壁，奪其軍。
translations.literal: Returning to reach Dingtao, he galloped into the King of Qi's encampment and seized his army.
translations.idiomatic: Upon returning to Dingtao, he charged into the King of Qi's camp and took command of his army.

context.previous: 遂以魯公號葬項羽穀城。

translations.chinese: 正月，諸侯及將相相與共請尊漢王為皇帝。
translations.literal: In the first month, the feudal lords and generals and ministers together jointly requested to honor the King of Han as Emperor.
translations.idiomatic: In the first month, the feudal lords and high officials jointly petitioned to honor the King of Han as Emperor.

context.next: 漢王曰：「吾聞帝賢者有也，空言虛語，非所守也，吾不敢當帝位。」

translations.chinese: 漢王曰：「吾聞帝賢者有也，空言虛語，非所守也，吾不敢當帝位。」
translations.literal: The King of Han said: "I have heard that the title of Emperor is something the worthy possess; empty words and vain speech are not what I uphold—I dare not accept the position of Emperor."
translations.idiomatic: The King of Han said: 'I have heard that the title of Emperor is something the worthy possess. Empty words and vain speech are not what I uphold—I dare not accept the position of Emperor.''

context.previous: 正月，諸侯及將相相與共請尊漢王為皇帝。
context.next: 群臣皆曰：「大王起微細，誅暴逆，平定四海，有功者輒裂地而封為王侯。

translations.chinese: 群臣皆曰：「大王起微細，誅暴逆，平定四海，有功者輒裂地而封為王侯。
translations.literal: The assembled ministers all said: "The great king arose from humble and minor beginnings, executed the violent and rebellious, pacified the four seas; those with achievements were immediately given divided territory and enfeoffed as kings and marquises.
translations.idiomatic: The assembled ministers all said: 'The great king arose from humble and minor beginnings, executed the violent and rebellious, pacified the four seas. Those with achievements were immediately given divided territory and enfeoffed as kings and marquises.'

context.previous: 漢王曰：「吾聞帝賢者有也，空言虛語，非所守也，吾不敢當帝位。」
context.next: 大王不尊號，皆疑不信。

translations.chinese: 大王不尊號，皆疑不信。
translations.literal: If great king not take honored title, all doubt not believe.
translations.idiomatic: If Your Majesty does not accept the imperial title, everyone will remain suspicious and distrustful.

context.previous: 群臣皆曰：「大王起微細，誅暴逆，平定四海，有功者輒裂地而封為王侯。
context.next: 臣等以死守之。」

translations.chinese: 臣等以死守之。」
translations.literal: We your ministers will defend this to the death."
translations.idiomatic: We your ministers will defend this to the death.''

context.previous: 大王不尊號，皆疑不信。
context.next: 漢王三讓，不得已，曰：「諸君必以為便，便國家。」

translations.chinese: 漢王三讓，不得已，曰：「諸君必以為便，便國家。」
translations.literal: The King of Han declined three times; unable to refuse, he said: "If you lords must consider it convenient and beneficial to the state."
translations.idiomatic: The King of Han declined three times. Unable to refuse, he said: 'If you lords must consider it convenient and beneficial to the state.''

context.previous: 臣等以死守之。」
context.next: 甲午，乃即皇帝位汜水之陽。

translations.chinese: 甲午，乃即皇帝位汜水之陽。
translations.literal: On the jiawu day, he then assumed the position of Emperor north of the Fan River.
translations.idiomatic: On the jiawu day, he ascended the imperial throne north of the Fan River.

context.previous: 漢王三讓，不得已，曰：「諸君必以為便，便國家。」

translations.chinese: 皇帝曰義帝無後。
translations.literal: The Emperor said the Righteous Emperor had no descendants.
translations.idiomatic: The Emperor declared that the Righteous Emperor had no heirs.

context.next: 齊王韓信習楚風俗，徙為楚王，都下邳。

translations.chinese: 齊王韓信習楚風俗，徙為楚王，都下邳。
translations.literal: King Han Xin of Qi was familiar with Chu customs and was moved to be King of Chu, with his capital at Xiapei.
translations.idiomatic: Since King Han Xin of Qi was familiar with Chu customs, he was transferred to become King of Chu with his capital at Xiapei.

context.previous: 皇帝曰義帝無後。
context.next: 立建成侯彭越為梁王，都定陶。

translations.chinese: 立建成侯彭越為梁王，都定陶。
translations.literal: He installed Marquis of Jiancheng Peng Yue as King of Liang, with his capital at Dingtao.
translations.idiomatic: He installed Marquis of Jiancheng Peng Yue as King of Liang with his capital at Dingtao.

context.previous: 齊王韓信習楚風俗，徙為楚王，都下邳。
context.next: 故韓王信為韓王，都陽翟。

translations.chinese: 故韓王信為韓王，都陽翟。
translations.literal: The former King Xin of Han remained King of Han, with his capital at Yangzhai.
translations.idiomatic: The former King Xin of Han remained as King of Han with his capital at Yangzhai.

context.previous: 立建成侯彭越為梁王，都定陶。
context.next: 徙衡山王吳芮為長沙王，都臨湘。

translations.chinese: 徙衡山王吳芮為長沙王，都臨湘。
translations.literal: He moved King Wu Rui of Hengshan to be King of Changsha, with his capital at Linxiang.
translations.idiomatic: He transferred King Wu Rui of Hengshan to become King of Changsha with his capital at Linxiang.

context.previous: 故韓王信為韓王，都陽翟。
context.next: 番君之將梅鋗有功，從入武關，故德番君。

translations.chinese: 番君之將梅鋗有功，從入武關，故德番君。
translations.literal: Lord Fan's general Mei Xuan had achievements and followed them entering Wuguan, therefore he favored Lord Fan.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Fan's general Mei Xuan had achievements and followed them entering Wuguan. Therefore he favored Lord Fan.

context.previous: 徙衡山王吳芮為長沙王，都臨湘。
context.next: 淮南王布、燕王臧荼、趙王敖皆如故。

translations.chinese: 淮南王布、燕王臧荼、趙王敖皆如故。
translations.literal: King Bu of Huainan, King Zang Tu of Yan, and King Ao of Zhao all remained as before.
translations.idiomatic: King Bu of Huainan, King Zang Tu of Yan, and King Ao of Zhao all kept their positions unchanged.

context.previous: 番君之將梅鋗有功，從入武關，故德番君。

translations.chinese: 天下大定。
translations.literal: All under Heaven was greatly settled.
translations.idiomatic: The empire was now firmly established.

context.next: 高祖都雒陽，諸侯皆臣屬。

translations.chinese: 高祖都雒陽，諸侯皆臣屬。
translations.literal: Gao Zu made capital Luoyang, feudal lords all became ministers subordinates.
translations.idiomatic: Gao Zu made capital Luoyang. Feudal lords all became ministers and subordinates.

context.previous: 天下大定。
context.next: 故臨江王驩為項羽叛漢，令盧綰、劉賈圍之，不下。

translations.chinese: 故臨江王驩為項羽叛漢，令盧綰、劉賈圍之，不下。
translations.literal: The former King Huan of Linjiang rebelled against Han for Xiang Yu; he ordered Lu Wan and Liu Jia to besiege him, but he did not surrender.
translations.idiomatic: The former King Huan of Linjiang rebelled against Han for Xiang Yu. He ordered Lu Wan and Liu Jia to besiege him, but he did not surrender.

context.previous: 高祖都雒陽，諸侯皆臣屬。
context.next: 數月而降，殺之雒陽。

translations.chinese: 數月而降，殺之雒陽。
translations.literal: After several months he surrendered and they killed him at Luoyang.
translations.idiomatic: After several months he surrendered, and they executed him at Luoyang.

context.previous: 故臨江王驩為項羽叛漢，令盧綰、劉賈圍之，不下。

translations.chinese: 五月，兵皆罷歸家。
translations.literal: In the fifth month, all troops were dismissed to return home.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth month, all troops were disbanded and sent home.

context.next: 諸侯子在關中者復之十二歲，其歸者復之六歲，食之一歲。

translations.chinese: 諸侯子在關中者復之十二歲，其歸者復之六歲，食之一歲。
translations.literal: Sons of feudal lords who were in Guanzhong were exempted from taxes for twelve years; those who returned were exempted for six years and provided food for one year.
translations.idiomatic: Sons of feudal lords who were in Guanzhong were exempted from taxes for twelve years. Those who returned were exempted for six years and provided food for one year.

context.previous: 五月，兵皆罷歸家。

translations.chinese: 高祖置酒雒陽南宮。
translations.literal: Gao Zu held a banquet at the Southern Palace of Luoyang.
translations.idiomatic: Gao Zu hosted a banquet at the Southern Palace in Luoyang.

context.next: 高祖曰：「列侯諸將無敢隱朕，皆言其情。

translations.chinese: 高祖曰：「列侯諸將無敢隱朕，皆言其情。
translations.literal: Gao Zu said: "Ranked marquises and various generals, do not hide from me; all speak your true feelings.
translations.idiomatic: Gao Zu said: 'Ranked marquises and various generals, do not hide from me. All speak your true feelings.'

context.previous: 高祖置酒雒陽南宮。
context.next: 吾所以有天下者何？

translations.chinese: 吾所以有天下者何？
translations.literal: Why is it that I possess all under Heaven?
translations.idiomatic: How did I come to rule the empire?

context.previous: 高祖曰：「列侯諸將無敢隱朕，皆言其情。
context.next: 項氏之所以失天下者何？」

translations.chinese: 項氏之所以失天下者何？」
translations.literal: Why is it that the Xiang clan lost all under Heaven?"
translations.idiomatic: Why is it that the Xiang clan lost all under Heaven?''

context.previous: 吾所以有天下者何？
context.next: 高起、王陵對曰：「陛下慢而侮人，項羽仁而愛人。

translations.chinese: 高起、王陵對曰：「陛下慢而侮人，項羽仁而愛人。
translations.literal: Gao Qi and Wang Ling replied: "Your Majesty is informal and makes light of people; Xiang Yu was benevolent and loved people.
translations.idiomatic: Gao Qi and Wang Ling replied: 'Your Majesty is informal and makes light of people. Xiang Yu was benevolent and loved people.'

context.previous: 項氏之所以失天下者何？」
context.next: 然陛下使人攻城略地，所降下者因以予之，與天下同利也。

translations.chinese: 然陛下使人攻城略地，所降下者因以予之，與天下同利也。
translations.literal: Yet Your Majesty has men attack cities and take territory; those who are subdued and surrender are consequently given it—you share benefits with all under Heaven.
translations.idiomatic: Yet Your Majesty has men attack cities and take territory. Those who are subdued and surrender are consequently given it—you share benefits with all under Heaven.'

context.previous: 高起、王陵對曰：「陛下慢而侮人，項羽仁而愛人。
context.next: 項羽妒賢嫉能，有功者害之，賢者疑之，戰勝而不予人功，得地而不予人利，此所以失天下也。」

translations.chinese: 項羽妒賢嫉能，有功者害之，賢者疑之，戰勝而不予人功，得地而不予人利，此所以失天下也。」
translations.literal: Xiang Yu was jealous of the worthy and envious of the able; those with achievements he harmed, the worthy he suspected; when battles were won he would not give others credit, when territory was obtained he would not give others benefits—this is why he lost all under Heaven."
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu was jealous of the worthy and envious of the able. Those with achievements he harmed, the worthy he suspected. When battles were won he would not give others credit, when territory was obtained he would not give others benefits—this is why he lost all under Heaven.''

context.previous: 然陛下使人攻城略地，所降下者因以予之，與天下同利也。
context.next: 高祖曰：「公知其一，未知其二。

translations.chinese: 高祖曰：「公知其一，未知其二。
translations.literal: Gao Zu said: "You know one aspect but do not know the second.
translations.idiomatic: Gao Zu said: 'You know one aspect but do not know the second.'

context.previous: 項羽妒賢嫉能，有功者害之，賢者疑之，戰勝而不予人功，得地而不予人利，此所以失天下也。」
context.next: 夫運籌策帷帳之中，決勝於千里之外，吾不如子房。

translations.chinese: 夫運籌策帷帳之中，決勝於千里之外，吾不如子房。
translations.literal: In devising strategies within the command tent and deciding victory a thousand li away, I am not equal to Zifang.
translations.idiomatic: In devising strategies within the command tent and deciding victory a thousand li away, I am not equal to Zifang.'

context.previous: 高祖曰：「公知其一，未知其二。
context.next: 鎮國家，撫百姓，給餽馕，不絕糧道，吾不如蕭何。

translations.chinese: 鎮國家，撫百姓，給餽馕，不絕糧道，吾不如蕭何。
translations.literal: In stabilizing the state, comforting the hundred clans, providing provisions and grain, and not severing the supply routes, I am not equal to Xiao He.
translations.idiomatic: In stabilizing the state, comforting the hundred clans, providing provisions and grain, and not severing the supply routes, I am not equal to Xiao He.'

context.previous: 夫運籌策帷帳之中，決勝於千里之外，吾不如子房。
context.next: 連百萬之軍，戰必勝，攻必取，吾不如韓信。

translations.chinese: 連百萬之軍，戰必勝，攻必取，吾不如韓信。
translations.literal: In commanding armies of a million, certainly winning battles and certainly taking what is attacked, I am not equal to Han Xin.
translations.idiomatic: In commanding armies of a million, certainly winning battles and certainly taking what is attacked, I am not equal to Han Xin.'

context.previous: 鎮國家，撫百姓，給餽馕，不絕糧道，吾不如蕭何。
context.next: 此三者，皆人傑也，吾能用之，此吾所以取天下也。

translations.chinese: 此三者，皆人傑也，吾能用之，此吾所以取天下也。
translations.literal: These three are all heroes among men, and I was able to employ them—this is why I took all under Heaven.
translations.idiomatic: These three are all heroes among men, and I was able to employ them—this is why I took all under Heaven.'

context.previous: 連百萬之軍，戰必勝，攻必取，吾不如韓信。
context.next: 項羽有一范增而不能用，此其所以為我擒也。」

translations.chinese: 項羽有一范增而不能用，此其所以為我擒也。」
translations.literal: Xiang Yu had one Fan Zeng but could not employ him—this is why he became my captive."
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Yu had one Fan Zeng but could not employ him—this is why he became my captive.''

context.previous: 此三者，皆人傑也，吾能用之，此吾所以取天下也。

translations.chinese: 高祖欲長都雒陽，齊人劉敬說，乃留侯勸上入都關中，高祖是日駕，入都關中。
translations.literal: Gao Zu wished to make Luoyang his permanent capital; the Qi man Liu Jing persuaded him, and the Marquis of Liu urged the superior to make his capital within the passes; Gao Zu that very day took his carriage and went in to make his capital within the passes.
translations.idiomatic: Gao Zu wished to make Luoyang his permanent capital. The Qi man Liu Jing persuaded him, and the Marquis of Liu urged the superior to make his capital within the passes. Gao Zu that very day took his carriage and went in to make his capital within the passes.

context.next: 六月，大赦天下。

translations.chinese: 六月，大赦天下。
translations.literal: In the sixth month, they granted a great amnesty to all under Heaven.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth month, a general amnesty was declared throughout the empire.

context.previous: 高祖欲長都雒陽，齊人劉敬說，乃留侯勸上入都關中，高祖是日駕，入都關中。

translations.chinese: 十月，燕王臧荼反，攻下代地。
translations.literal: In the tenth month, King Zang Tu of Yan rebelled and attacked and took the land of Dai.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month, King Zang Tu of Yan rebelled and conquered the territory of Dai.

context.next: 高祖自將擊之，得燕王臧荼。

translations.chinese: 高祖自將擊之，得燕王臧荼。
translations.literal: Gao Zu personally commanded to strike him and captured King Zang Tu of Yan.
translations.idiomatic: Gao Zu personally led the attack and captured King Zang Tu of Yan.

context.previous: 十月，燕王臧荼反，攻下代地。
context.next: 即立太尉盧綰為燕王。

translations.chinese: 即立太尉盧綰為燕王。
translations.literal: He immediately installed Grand Commandant Lu Wan as King of Yan.
translations.idiomatic: He immediately installed Grand Commandant Lu Wan as King of Yan.

context.previous: 高祖自將擊之，得燕王臧荼。
context.next: 使丞相噲將兵攻代。

translations.chinese: 使丞相噲將兵攻代。
translations.literal: He sent Prime Minister Kuai to lead troops to attack Dai.
translations.idiomatic: He sent Prime Minister Kuai to lead an army against Dai.

context.previous: 即立太尉盧綰為燕王。

translations.chinese: 其秋，利幾反，高祖自將兵擊之，利幾走。
translations.literal: That autumn, Li Ji rebelled; Gao Zu personally led troops to strike him; Li Ji fled.
translations.idiomatic: That autumn, Li Ji rebelled. Gao Zu personally led troops to strike him. Li Ji fled.

context.next: 利幾者，項氏之將。

translations.chinese: 利幾者，項氏之將。
translations.literal: Li Ji was a general of the Xiang clan.
translations.idiomatic: Li Ji was one of Xiang Yu's generals.

context.previous: 其秋，利幾反，高祖自將兵擊之，利幾走。
context.next: 項氏敗，利幾為陳公，不隨項羽，亡降高祖，高祖侯之潁川。

translations.chinese: 項氏敗，利幾為陳公，不隨項羽，亡降高祖，高祖侯之潁川。
translations.literal: When the Xiang clan was defeated, Li Ji was Duke of Chen and did not follow Xiang Yu; he fled and surrendered to Gao Zu, and Gao Zu made him a marquis at Yingchuan.
translations.idiomatic: When the Xiang clan was defeated, Li Ji was Duke of Chen and did not follow Xiang Yu. He fled and surrendered to Gao Zu, and Gao Zu made him a marquis at Yingchuan.

context.previous: 利幾者，項氏之將。
context.next: 高祖至雒陽，舉通侯籍召之，而利幾恐，故反。

translations.chinese: 高祖至雒陽，舉通侯籍召之，而利幾恐，故反。
translations.literal: When Gao Zu reached Luoyang, he raised the register of ranked marquises and summoned him; Li Ji was afraid and therefore rebelled.
translations.idiomatic: When Gao Zu reached Luoyang, he raised the register of ranked marquises and summoned him. Li Ji was afraid and therefore rebelled.

context.previous: 項氏敗，利幾為陳公，不隨項羽，亡降高祖，高祖侯之潁川。

translations.chinese: 六年，高祖五日一朝太公，如家人父子禮。
translations.literal: In the sixth year, Gao Zu every five days would have an audience with the Grand Duke, following the rites of father and son in an ordinary family.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, Gao Zu would visit his father every five days, treating him with the simple respect of father and son in a common family.

context.next: 太公家令說太公曰：「天無二日，土無二王。

translations.chinese: 太公家令說太公曰：「天無二日，土無二王。
translations.literal: The Grand Duke's steward persuaded the Grand Duke, saying: "Heaven has no two suns; the land has no two kings.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Duke's steward persuaded the Grand Duke, saying: 'Heaven has no two suns. The land has no two kings.'

context.previous: 六年，高祖五日一朝太公，如家人父子禮。
context.next: 今高祖雖子，人主也；

translations.chinese: 今高祖雖子，人主也；
translations.literal: Now though Gao Zu is your son, he is the lord of men;
translations.idiomatic: Now though Gao Zu is your son, he is the lord of men;'

context.previous: 太公家令說太公曰：「天無二日，土無二王。
context.next: 太公雖父，人臣也。

translations.chinese: 太公雖父，人臣也。
translations.literal: though the Grand Duke is his father, you are a minister of men.
translations.idiomatic: though the Grand Duke is his father, you are a minister of men.'

context.previous: 今高祖雖子，人主也；
context.next: 柰何令人主拜人臣！

translations.chinese: 柰何令人主拜人臣！
translations.literal: How can you have the lord of men bow to a minister of men!
translations.idiomatic: How can you have the lord of men bow to a minister of men!''

context.previous: 太公雖父，人臣也。
context.next: 如此，則威重不行。」

translations.chinese: 如此，則威重不行。」
translations.literal: If this continues, authority and dignity will not function."
translations.idiomatic: If this continues, authority and dignity will not function.''

context.previous: 柰何令人主拜人臣！
context.next: 後高祖朝，太公擁篲，迎門卻行。

translations.chinese: 後高祖朝，太公擁篲，迎門卻行。
translations.literal: Later when Gao Zu came to audience, the Grand Duke held a broom, welcomed him at the gate, and walked backward.
translations.idiomatic: Later when Gao Zu came for an audience, his father greeted him at the gate holding a broom and backed away respectfully.

context.previous: 如此，則威重不行。」
context.next: 高祖大驚，下扶太公。

translations.chinese: 高祖大驚，下扶太公。
translations.literal: Gao Zu was greatly shocked and got down to support the Grand Duke.
translations.idiomatic: Gao Zu was horrified and dismounted to help his father up.

context.previous: 後高祖朝，太公擁篲，迎門卻行。
context.next: 太公曰：「帝，人主也，柰何以我亂天下法！」

translations.chinese: 太公曰：「帝，人主也，柰何以我亂天下法！」
translations.literal: The Grand Duke said: "The Emperor is the lord of men—how can you use me to disorder the laws of all under Heaven!"
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Duke said: 'The Emperor is the lord of men—how can you use me to disorder the laws of all under Heaven!'

context.previous: 高祖大驚，下扶太公。
context.next: 於是高祖乃尊太公為太上皇。

translations.chinese: 於是高祖乃尊太公為太上皇。
translations.literal: Thereupon Gao Zu then honored the Grand Duke as Grand Supreme Sovereign.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon Gao Zu honored his father as the Supreme Retired Emperor.

context.previous: 太公曰：「帝，人主也，柰何以我亂天下法！」
context.next: 心善家令言，賜金五百斤。

translations.chinese: 心善家令言，賜金五百斤。
translations.literal: In heart approved steward words, bestowed five hundred jin gold.
translations.idiomatic: In his heart he approved the steward's words and bestowed five hundred jin of gold.

context.previous: 於是高祖乃尊太公為太上皇。

translations.chinese: 十二月，人有上變事告楚王信謀反，上問左右，左右爭欲擊之。
translations.literal: In the twelfth month, someone submitted a report accusing the King of Chu Xin of plotting rebellion; the superior asked those around him, and those around him competed to attack him.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth month, someone submitted a report accusing the King of Chu Xin of plotting rebellion. The superior asked those around him, and those around him competed to attack him.

context.next: 用陳平計，乃偽遊雲夢，會諸侯於陳，楚王信迎，即因執之。

translations.chinese: 用陳平計，乃偽遊雲夢，會諸侯於陳，楚王信迎，即因執之。
translations.literal: Using Chen Ping's plan, he then pretended to make a tour to Yunmeng and assembled the feudal lords at Chen; the King of Chu Xin came to welcome him and was consequently seized.
translations.idiomatic: Using Chen Ping's plan, he then pretended to make a tour to Yunmeng and assembled the feudal lords at Chen. The King of Chu Xin came to welcome him and was consequently seized.

context.previous: 十二月，人有上變事告楚王信謀反，上問左右，左右爭欲擊之。
context.next: 是日，大赦天下。

translations.chinese: 是日，大赦天下。
translations.literal: That day, they granted a great amnesty to all under Heaven.
translations.idiomatic: That day, a general amnesty was declared throughout the empire.

context.previous: 用陳平計，乃偽遊雲夢，會諸侯於陳，楚王信迎，即因執之。
context.next: 田肯賀，因說高祖曰：「陛下得韓信，又治秦中。

translations.chinese: 田肯賀，因說高祖曰：「陛下得韓信，又治秦中。
translations.literal: Tian Ken congratulated him and consequently persuaded Gao Zu, saying: "Your Majesty has obtained Han Xin and also governs the Qin heartland.
translations.idiomatic: Tian Ken congratulated him and consequently persuaded Gao Zu, saying: 'Your Majesty has obtained Han Xin and also governs the Qin heartland.'

context.previous: 是日，大赦天下。
context.next: 秦，形勝之國，帶河山之險，縣隔千里，持戟百萬，秦得百二焉。

translations.chinese: 秦，形勝之國，帶河山之險，縣隔千里，持戟百萬，秦得百二焉。
translations.literal: Qin is a state of natural advantage, girded by the dangers of rivers and mountains, separated by a thousand li, wielding a million halberds—Qin obtains a hundred to two advantage.
translations.idiomatic: Qin is a naturally fortified state, protected by perilous rivers and mountains, spanning a thousand li, with a million soldiers under arms—Qin enjoys a 50-to-1 advantage.

context.previous: 田肯賀，因說高祖曰：「陛下得韓信，又治秦中。
context.next: 地勢便利，其以下兵於諸侯，譬猶居高屋之上建瓴水也。

translations.chinese: 地勢便利，其以下兵於諸侯，譬猶居高屋之上建瓴水也。
translations.literal: The terrain is convenient and advantageous; using it to send down troops against the feudal lords is like residing atop a tall building pouring water from a roof."
translations.idiomatic: The terrain is convenient and advantageous; using it to send down troops against the feudal lords is like residing atop a tall building pouring water from a roof.''

context.previous: 秦，形勝之國，帶河山之險，縣隔千里，持戟百萬，秦得百二焉。
context.next: 夫齊，東有瑯邪、即墨之饒，南有泰山之固，西有濁河之限，北有勃海之利。

translations.chinese: 夫齊，東有瑯邪、即墨之饒，南有泰山之固，西有濁河之限，北有勃海之利。
translations.literal: As for Qi, to the east it has the wealth of Langye and Jimo, to the south the stronghold of Mount Tai, to the west the barrier of the Turbid River, to the north the benefits of the Bohai.
translations.idiomatic: As for Qi, to the east it has the riches of Langye and Jimo, to the south the impregnable Mount Tai, to the west the barrier of the muddy Yellow River, to the north the bounty of Bohai Bay.

context.previous: 地勢便利，其以下兵於諸侯，譬猶居高屋之上建瓴水也。
context.next: 地方二千里，持戟百萬，縣隔千里之外，齊得十二焉。

translations.chinese: 地方二千里，持戟百萬，縣隔千里之外，齊得十二焉。
translations.literal: Its territory is two thousand li square, wielding a million halberds, separated a thousand li away—Qi obtains a ten to two advantage.
translations.idiomatic: Its territory spans 2,000 square li, with a million soldiers, and lies a thousand li distant—Qi enjoys a 5-to-1 advantage.

context.previous: 夫齊，東有瑯邪、即墨之饒，南有泰山之固，西有濁河之限，北有勃海之利。
context.next: 故此東西秦也。

translations.chinese: 故此東西秦也。
translations.literal: Therefore this is the eastern Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore Qi is another Qin in the east.

context.previous: 地方二千里，持戟百萬，縣隔千里之外，齊得十二焉。
context.next: 非親子弟，莫可使王齊矣。」

translations.chinese: 非親子弟，莫可使王齊矣。」
translations.literal: Unless it is your own sons and younger brothers, none should be sent to be king of Qi."
translations.idiomatic: Unless it is your own sons and younger brothers, none should be sent to be king of Qi.''

context.previous: 故此東西秦也。
context.next: 高祖曰：「善。」

translations.chinese: 高祖曰：「善。」
translations.literal: Gao Zu said: "Excellent."
translations.idiomatic: Gao Zu said: 'Excellent.''

context.previous: 非親子弟，莫可使王齊矣。」
context.next: 賜黃金五百斤。

translations.chinese: 賜黃金五百斤。
translations.literal: He bestowed five hundred jin of gold.
translations.idiomatic: He awarded him 500 jin of gold.

context.previous: 高祖曰：「善。」

translations.chinese: 後十餘日，封韓信為淮陰侯，分其地為二國。
translations.literal: After over ten days, he enfeoffed Han Xin as Marquis of Huaiyin and divided his territory into two states.
translations.idiomatic: More than ten days later, he enfeoffed Han Xin as Marquis of Huaiyin and split his territory into two kingdoms.

context.next: 高祖曰將軍劉賈數有功，以為荊王，王淮東。

translations.chinese: 高祖曰將軍劉賈數有功，以為荊王，王淮東。
translations.literal: Gao Zu said General Liu Jia had repeatedly achieved merit and made him King of Jing, ruling east of the Huai.
translations.idiomatic: Gao Zu said: 'General Liu Jia has repeatedly achieved merit and made him King of Jing, ruling east of the Huai.'

context.previous: 後十餘日，封韓信為淮陰侯，分其地為二國。
context.next: 弟交為楚王，王淮西。

translations.chinese: 弟交為楚王，王淮西。
translations.literal: His younger brother Jiao became King of Chu, ruling west of the Huai.
translations.idiomatic: His younger brother Jiao became King of Chu, ruling the area west of the Huai River.

context.previous: 高祖曰將軍劉賈數有功，以為荊王，王淮東。
context.next: 子肥為齊王，王七十餘城，民能齊言者皆屬齊。

translations.chinese: 子肥為齊王，王七十餘城，民能齊言者皆屬齊。
translations.literal: His son Fei became King of Qi, ruling over seventy cities; all people who could speak the Qi language belonged to Qi.
translations.idiomatic: His son Fei became King of Qi, ruling over 70 cities; all people who spoke the Qi dialect were assigned to Qi.

context.previous: 弟交為楚王，王淮西。
context.next: 乃論功，與諸列侯剖符行封。

translations.chinese: 乃論功，與諸列侯剖符行封。
translations.literal: He then evaluated merits and with all the ranked marquises divided tallies and carried out enfeoffments.
translations.idiomatic: He then assessed everyone's merits and granted fiefs to the marquises, dividing the tally tallies as proof.

context.previous: 子肥為齊王，王七十餘城，民能齊言者皆屬齊。
context.next: 徙韓王信太原。

translations.chinese: 徙韓王信太原。
translations.literal: He moved King Xin of Han to Taiyuan.
translations.idiomatic: He transferred King Xin of Han to Taiyuan.

context.previous: 乃論功，與諸列侯剖符行封。

translations.chinese: 七年，匈奴攻韓王信馬邑，信因與謀反太原。
translations.literal: In the seventh year, the Xiongnu attacked King Xin of Han at Mayi; Xin consequently plotted rebellion with them at Taiyuan.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, the Xiongnu attacked King Xin of Han at Mayi; Xin took this opportunity to plot rebellion with them at Taiyuan.

context.next: 白土曼丘臣、王黃立故趙將趙利為王以反，高祖自往擊之。

translations.chinese: 白土曼丘臣、王黃立故趙將趙利為王以反，高祖自往擊之。
translations.literal: Man Qiu Chen of Baitu and Wang Huang installed the former Zhao general Zhao Li as king to rebel; Gao Zu personally went to strike them.
translations.idiomatic: Man Qiu Chen of Baitu and Wang Huang set up the former Zhao general Zhao Li as king to rebel; Gao Zu personally went to attack them.

context.previous: 七年，匈奴攻韓王信馬邑，信因與謀反太原。
context.next: 會天寒，士卒墮指者什二三，遂至平城。

translations.chinese: 會天寒，士卒墮指者什二三，遂至平城。
translations.literal: Meeting cold weather, two or three out of ten officers and troops lost fingers; they then reached Pingcheng.
translations.idiomatic: They encountered bitterly cold weather, and 20-30% of the soldiers suffered frostbite and lost fingers; they finally reached Pingcheng.

context.previous: 白土曼丘臣、王黃立故趙將趙利為王以反，高祖自往擊之。
context.next: 匈奴圍我平城，七日而後罷去。

translations.chinese: 匈奴圍我平城，七日而後罷去。
translations.literal: The Xiongnu surrounded us at Pingcheng for seven days before withdrawing.
translations.idiomatic: The Xiongnu besieged us at Pingcheng for seven days before finally withdrawing.

context.previous: 會天寒，士卒墮指者什二三，遂至平城。
context.next: 令樊噲止定代地。

translations.chinese: 令樊噲止定代地。
translations.literal: He ordered Fan Kuai to remain and settle the land of Dai.
translations.idiomatic: He ordered Fan Kuai to stay behind and pacify the territory of Dai.

context.previous: 匈奴圍我平城，七日而後罷去。
context.next: 立兄劉仲為代王。

translations.chinese: 立兄劉仲為代王。
translations.literal: He installed his elder brother Liu Zhong as King of Dai.
translations.idiomatic: He installed his elder brother Liu Zhong as King of Dai.

context.previous: 令樊噲止定代地。

translations.chinese: 二月，高祖自平城過趙、雒陽，至長安。
translations.literal: In the second month, Gao Zu from Pingcheng passed through Zhao and Luoyang and reached Chang'an.
translations.idiomatic: In the second month, Gao Zu traveled from Pingcheng through Zhao and Luoyang to reach Chang'an.

context.next: 長樂宮成，丞相已下徙治長安。

translations.chinese: 長樂宮成，丞相已下徙治長安。
translations.literal: Changle Palace was completed; the prime minister and below moved to govern at Chang'an.
translations.idiomatic: Changle Palace was completed; the prime minister and all officials below him moved their administration to Chang'an.

context.previous: 二月，高祖自平城過趙、雒陽，至長安。

translations.chinese: 八年，高祖東擊韓王信餘反寇於東垣。
translations.literal: In the eighth year, Gao Zu went east to strike the remaining rebel bandits of King Xin of Han at Dongyuan.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, Gao Zu marched east to crush the remaining rebel forces of King Xin of Han at Dongyuan.

translations.chinese: 蕭丞相營作未央宮，立東闕、北闕、前殿、武庫、太倉。
translations.literal: Prime Minister Xiao constructed Weiyang Palace, establishing the Eastern Tower, Northern Tower, Front Hall, Armory, and Great Granary.
translations.idiomatic: Prime Minister Xiao oversaw the construction of Weiyang Palace, including the Eastern Gate Tower, Northern Gate Tower, Front Hall, Armory, and Great Granary.

context.next: 高祖還，見宮闕壯甚，怒，謂蕭何曰：「天下匈匈苦戰數歲，成敗未可知，是何治宮室過度也？」

translations.chinese: 高祖還，見宮闕壯甚，怒，謂蕭何曰：「天下匈匈苦戰數歲，成敗未可知，是何治宮室過度也？」
translations.literal: When Gao Zu returned and saw the palace towers were exceedingly grand, he was angry and said to Xiao He: "All under Heaven has suffered bitterly fighting for several years; success or failure cannot yet be known—why do you govern palace chambers to excess?"
translations.idiomatic: When Gao Zu returned and saw the palace towers were exceedingly grand, he was angry and said to Xiao He: 'All under Heaven has suffered bitterly fighting for several years; success or failure cannot yet be known—why do you govern palace chambers to excess?'

context.previous: 蕭丞相營作未央宮，立東闕、北闕、前殿、武庫、太倉。
context.next: 蕭何曰：「天下方未定，故可因遂就宮室。

translations.chinese: 蕭何曰：「天下方未定，故可因遂就宮室。
translations.literal: Xiao He said: "Precisely because all under Heaven is not yet settled, we can consequently proceed to complete the palace chambers.
translations.idiomatic: Xiao He said: 'Precisely because all under Heaven is not yet settled, we can consequently proceed to complete the palace chambers.'

context.previous: 高祖還，見宮闕壯甚，怒，謂蕭何曰：「天下匈匈苦戰數歲，成敗未可知，是何治宮室過度也？」
context.next: 且夫天子四海為家，非壯麗無以重威，且無令後世有以加也。」

translations.chinese: 且夫天子四海為家，非壯麗無以重威，且無令後世有以加也。」
translations.literal: Moreover, the Son of Heaven has the four seas as his home; without grandeur and magnificence there is no way to give weight to authority, and moreover we must not allow later generations to have anything to add."
translations.idiomatic: Moreover, the Son of Heaven has the four seas as his home; without grandeur and magnificence there is no way to give weight to authority, and moreover we must not allow later generations to have anything to add.''

context.previous: 蕭何曰：「天下方未定，故可因遂就宮室。
context.next: 高祖乃說。

translations.chinese: 高祖乃說。
translations.literal: Gao Zu was then pleased.
translations.idiomatic: Gao Zu was greatly pleased.

translations.idiomatic: Han dispatched General Guo Meng along with Qi generals to attack and decisively defeat them.

translations.literal: He then departed.
translations.idiomatic: So he left.

context.previous: 高祖曰：「吾人眾多，父兄不能給。」
context.next: 沛中空縣皆之邑西獻。

translations.chinese: 沛中空縣皆之邑西獻。
translations.literal: The entire county of Pei went to the west of the township to present offerings.
translations.idiomatic: The whole county of Pei gathered west of the town to present farewell gifts.

context.previous: 乃去。
context.next: 高祖復留止，張飲三日。

translations.chinese: 高祖復留止，張飲三日。
translations.literal: Gao Zu again remained and stopped, holding banquets and drinking for three days.
translations.idiomatic: Gao Zu stayed again and pitched camp, feasting and drinking for three days.

context.previous: 沛中空縣皆之邑西獻。
context.next: 沛父兄皆頓首曰：「沛幸得復，豐未復，唯陛下哀憐之。」

translations.chinese: 沛父兄皆頓首曰：「沛幸得復，豐未復，唯陛下哀憐之。」
translations.literal: The fathers and elder brothers of Pei all kowtowed and said: "Pei has been fortunate to obtain exemption; Feng has not been exempted—we only hope Your Majesty will take pity on it."
translations.idiomatic: Pei's elders all bowed low and said: 'Pei has been lucky to get tax exemption; Feng has not. We beg Your Majesty to show mercy to it.'

context.previous: 高祖復留止，張飲三日。
context.next: 高祖曰：「豐吾所生長，極不忘耳，吾特為其以雍齒故反我為魏。」

translations.chinese: 高祖曰：「豐吾所生長，極不忘耳，吾特為其以雍齒故反我為魏。」
translations.literal: Gao Zu said: "Feng is where I was born and grew up—I absolutely do not forget it; I particularly hold it against them that because of Yong Chi they rebelled against me for Wei."
translations.idiomatic: Gao Zu replied: 'Feng is my birthplace—I'll never forget that. But I resent them because they sided with Wei and rebelled against me on account of Yong Chi.'

context.previous: 沛父兄皆頓首曰：「沛幸得復，豐未復，唯陛下哀憐之。」
context.next: 沛父兄固請，乃并復豐，比沛。

translations.chinese: 沛父兄固請，乃并復豐，比沛。
translations.literal: The fathers and elder brothers of Pei firmly requested; he then also exempted Feng, equal to Pei.
translations.idiomatic: Pei's elders kept pleading, so he granted Feng the same tax exemption as Pei.

context.previous: 高祖曰：「豐吾所生長，極不忘耳，吾特為其以雍齒故反我為魏。」
context.next: 於是拜沛侯劉濞為吳王。

translations.chinese: 於是拜沛侯劉濞為吳王。
translations.literal: Thereupon he appointed Marquis Liu Bi of Pei as King of Wu.
translations.idiomatic: He then appointed Liu Bi, Marquis of Pei, as King of Wu.

context.previous: 沛父兄固請，乃并復豐，比沛。

translations.chinese: 漢將別擊布軍洮水南北，皆大破之，追得斬布鄱陽。
translations.literal: Han generals separately struck Bu's army south and north of the Tao River, all greatly breaking them; pursuing they obtained and beheaded Bu at Poyang.
translations.idiomatic: Han generals launched separate attacks on Bu's army north and south of the Tao River, routing them all. In pursuit they caught and executed Bu at Poyang.

translations.chinese: 樊噲別將兵定代，斬陳豨當城。
translations.literal: Fan Kuai separately led troops to settle Dai and beheaded Chen Xi at Dangcheng.
translations.idiomatic: Fan Kuai led a separate force to pacify Dai and executed Chen Xi at Dangcheng.

translations.chinese: 十一月，高祖自布軍至長安。
translations.literal: In the eleventh month, Gao Zu from Bu's army reached Chang'an.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh month, Gao Zu returned from the campaign against Bu and arrived at Chang'an.

context.next: 十二月，高祖曰：「秦始皇帝、楚隱王陳涉、魏安釐王、齊緡王、趙悼襄王皆絕無後，予守冢各十家，秦皇帝二十家，魏公子無忌五家。」

translations.chinese: 十二月，高祖曰：「秦始皇帝、楚隱王陳涉、魏安釐王、齊緡王、趙悼襄王皆絕無後，予守冢各十家，秦皇帝二十家，魏公子無忌五家。」
translations.literal: In the twelfth month, Gao Zu said: "The First Emperor of Qin, King Yin of Chu Chen She, King Anli of Wei, King Min of Qi, and King Daoxiang of Zhao are all extinct without descendants; I bestow ten families each to guard their tombs, twenty families for the Emperor of Qin, and five families for Lord Wuji of Wei."
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth month, Gao Zu declared: 'The First Emperor of Qin, King Yin of Chu Chen She, King Anli of Wei, King Min of Qi, and King Daoxiang of Zhao all died without heirs. I grant ten families each to tend their tombs, twenty for the Qin Emperor, and five for Lord Wuji of Wei.'

context.previous: 十一月，高祖自布軍至長安。
context.next: 赦代地吏民為陳豨、趙利所劫掠者，皆赦之。

translations.chinese: 赦代地吏民為陳豨、趙利所劫掠者，皆赦之。
translations.literal: He pardoned the officials and people of the land of Dai who had been coerced and plundered by Chen Xi and Zhao Li—all were pardoned.
translations.idiomatic: He pardoned all the officials and people of Dai who had been forced into service and plundered by Chen Xi and Zhao Li.

context.previous: 十二月，高祖曰：「秦始皇帝、楚隱王陳涉、魏安釐王、齊緡王、趙悼襄王皆絕無後，予守冢各十家，秦皇帝二十家，魏公子無忌五家。」
context.next: 陳豨降將言豨反時，燕王盧綰使人之豨所，與陰謀。

translations.chinese: 陳豨降將言豨反時，燕王盧綰使人之豨所，與陰謀。
translations.literal: Chen Xi's surrendered generals reported that when Xi rebelled, King Lu Wan of Yan sent men to Xi's location and secretly plotted with him.
translations.idiomatic: Chen Xi's surrendered generals revealed that when Xi rebelled, King Lu Wan of Yan had sent agents to Xi's camp to conspire with him in secret.

context.previous: 赦代地吏民為陳豨、趙利所劫掠者，皆赦之。
context.next: 上使辟陽侯迎綰，綰稱病。

translations.chinese: 上使辟陽侯迎綰，綰稱病。
translations.literal: The superior sent Marquis of Biyang to summon Wan; Wan claimed illness.
translations.idiomatic: The emperor sent the Marquis of Biyang to summon Wan, but Wan pleaded illness.

context.previous: 陳豨降將言豨反時，燕王盧綰使人之豨所，與陰謀。
context.next: 辟陽侯歸，具言綰反有端矣。

translations.chinese: 辟陽侯歸，具言綰反有端矣。
translations.literal: Marquis of Biyang returned and fully reported that Wan's rebellion had signs.
translations.idiomatic: The Marquis of Biyang returned and gave a full report that there were clear signs of Wan's rebellion.

context.previous: 上使辟陽侯迎綰，綰稱病。
context.next: 二月，使樊噲、周勃將兵擊燕王綰，赦燕吏民與反者。

translations.chinese: 二月，使樊噲、周勃將兵擊燕王綰，赦燕吏民與反者。
translations.literal: In the second month, they sent Fan Kuai and Zhou Bo to lead troops to strike King Wan of Yan and pardoned the officials and people of Yan who had joined the rebellion.
translations.idiomatic: In the second month, they dispatched Fan Kuai and Zhou Bo to lead troops against King Wan of Yan, pardoning Yan officials and people who had joined the rebellion.

context.previous: 辟陽侯歸，具言綰反有端矣。
context.next: 立皇子建為燕王。

translations.chinese: 立皇子建為燕王。
translations.literal: They installed the imperial son Jian as King of Yan.
translations.idiomatic: They installed the emperor's son Jian as King of Yan.

context.previous: 二月，使樊噲、周勃將兵擊燕王綰，赦燕吏民與反者。

translations.chinese: 高祖擊布時，為流矢所中，行道病。
translations.literal: When Gao Zu struck Bu, he was hit by a stray arrow; on the road he fell ill.
translations.idiomatic: While Gao Zu was campaigning against Bu, he was struck by a stray arrow and fell ill on the march.

context.next: 病甚，呂后迎良醫，醫入見，高祖問醫，醫曰：「病可治。」

translations.chinese: 病甚，呂后迎良醫，醫入見，高祖問醫，醫曰：「病可治。」
translations.literal: The illness was severe; Empress Lü summoned a good physician; when the physician entered to see him, Gao Zu questioned the physician, who said: "The illness can be treated."
translations.idiomatic: His illness worsened severely. Empress Lü summoned skilled doctors. When one entered to examine him, Gao Zu asked the physician, who replied: 'Your illness can be cured.'

context.previous: 高祖擊布時，為流矢所中，行道病。
context.next: 於是高祖嫚罵之曰：「吾以布衣提三尺劍取天下，此非天命乎？

translations.chinese: 於是高祖嫚罵之曰：「吾以布衣提三尺劍取天下，此非天命乎？
translations.literal: Thereupon Gao Zu reviled him rudely, saying: "I with a commoner's cloth raised a three-foot sword and took all under Heaven—is this not the Mandate of Heaven?
translations.idiomatic: Gao Zu then cursed him angrily: 'I rose from rags, wielding a three-foot sword to conquer the realm. Isn't this Heaven's will?'

context.previous: 病甚，呂后迎良醫，醫入見，高祖問醫，醫曰：「病可治。」
context.next: 命乃在天，雖扁鵲何益！」

translations.chinese: 命乃在天，雖扁鵲何益！」
translations.literal: Fate lies with Heaven—even if it were Bian Que, what benefit would there be!"
translations.idiomatic: Destiny is in Heaven's hands. Even the great physician Bian Que couldn't help!'

context.previous: 於是高祖嫚罵之曰：「吾以布衣提三尺劍取天下，此非天命乎？
context.next: 遂不使治病，賜金五十斤罷之。

translations.chinese: 遂不使治病，賜金五十斤罷之。
translations.literal: He then would not allow treatment of the illness, bestowed fifty jin of gold, and dismissed him.
translations.idiomatic: He refused treatment, gave the doctor fifty jin of gold, and sent him away.

context.previous: 命乃在天，雖扁鵲何益！」
context.next: 已而呂后問：「陛下百歲後，蕭相國即死，令誰代之？」

translations.chinese: 已而呂后問：「陛下百歲後，蕭相國即死，令誰代之？」
translations.literal: Soon after, Empress Lü asked: "After Your Majesty's hundred years, if Prime Minister Xiao dies, whom should we order to replace him?"
translations.idiomatic: Soon after, Empress Lü asked: 'After Your Majesty passes away, if Prime Minister Xiao dies, who should succeed him?'

context.previous: 遂不使治病，賜金五十斤罷之。
context.next: 上曰：「曹參可。」

translations.chinese: 上曰：「曹參可。」
translations.literal: The superior said: "Cao Can is acceptable."
translations.idiomatic: The emperor replied: 'Cao Can is suitable.'

context.previous: 已而呂后問：「陛下百歲後，蕭相國即死，令誰代之？」
context.next: 問其次，上曰：「王陵可。

translations.chinese: 問其次，上曰：「王陵可。
translations.literal: She asked about the next; the superior said: "Wang Ling is acceptable.
translations.idiomatic: She asked about the next in line, and the emperor said: 'Wang Ling is suitable.'

context.previous: 上曰：「曹參可。」
context.next: 然陵少憨，陳平可以助之。

translations.chinese: 然陵少憨，陳平可以助之。
translations.literal: However, Ling is somewhat naive; Chen Ping can assist him.
translations.idiomatic: But Ling is a bit naive. Chen Ping can help him.'

context.previous: 問其次，上曰：「王陵可。
context.next: 陳平智有餘，然難以獨任。

translations.chinese: 陳平智有餘，然難以獨任。
translations.literal: Chen Ping has intelligence in excess but is difficult to employ alone.
translations.idiomatic: Chen Ping is very clever but can't be trusted on his own.'

context.previous: 然陵少憨，陳平可以助之。
context.next: 周勃重厚少文，然安劉氏者必勃也，可令為太尉。」

translations.chinese: 周勃重厚少文，然安劉氏者必勃也，可令為太尉。」
translations.literal: Zhou Bo is solid and serious but lacks culture; however, he who will secure the Liu clan will certainly be Bo—you can order him to be Grand Commandant."
translations.idiomatic: Zhou Bo is reliable and steady but unrefined. Yet he is the one who will secure the Liu family. Make him Grand Commandant.''

context.previous: 陳平智有餘，然難以獨任。
context.next: 呂后復問其次，上曰：「此後亦非而所知也。」

translations.chinese: 呂后復問其次，上曰：「此後亦非而所知也。」
translations.literal: Empress Lü again asked about the next; the superior said: "After this it will also not be what you can know."
translations.idiomatic: Empress Lü pressed for the next name, but the emperor said: 'After these, it's not for you to know.''

context.previous: 周勃重厚少文，然安劉氏者必勃也，可令為太尉。」

translations.chinese: 盧綰與數千騎居塞下候伺，幸上病愈自入謝。
translations.literal: Lu Wan with several thousand cavalry remained below the frontier passes waiting and watching, hoping the superior's illness would improve so he could come in himself to apologize.
translations.idiomatic: Lu Wan waited at the frontier with several thousand cavalry, hoping the emperor would recover so he could come in person to apologize.

translations.chinese: 四月甲辰，高祖崩長樂宮。
translations.literal: On the jiachen day of the fourth month, Gao Zu died at Changle Palace.
translations.idiomatic: On the jiachen day of the fourth month, Emperor Gaozu passed away in Changle Palace.

context.next: 四日不發喪。

translations.chinese: 四日不發喪。
translations.literal: For four days they did not announce the death.
translations.idiomatic: They kept his death secret for four days.

context.previous: 四月甲辰，高祖崩長樂宮。
context.next: 呂后與審食其謀曰：「諸將與帝為編戶民，今北面為臣，此常怏怏，今乃事少主，非盡族是，天下不安。」

translations.chinese: 呂后與審食其謀曰：「諸將與帝為編戶民，今北面為臣，此常怏怏，今乃事少主，非盡族是，天下不安。」
translations.literal: Empress Lü plotted with Shen Yiji, saying: "The various generals were registered household commoners with the Emperor; now they face north as ministers—they are constantly resentful; now they will serve a young lord—unless we completely exterminate the clans, all under Heaven will not be secure."
translations.idiomatic: Empress Lü conspired with Shen Yiji: 'The generals were once commoners like the emperor. Now they bow to him as subjects and harbor constant resentment. Serving a young ruler will be unbearable. Unless we wipe out their entire clans, the realm will never be safe.'

context.previous: 四日不發喪。
context.next: 人或聞之，語酈將軍。

translations.chinese: 人或聞之，語酈將軍。
translations.literal: Someone heard this and told General Li.
translations.idiomatic: Someone overheard this and informed General Li.

context.previous: 呂后與審食其謀曰：「諸將與帝為編戶民，今北面為臣，此常怏怏，今乃事少主，非盡族是，天下不安。」
context.next: 酈將軍往見審食其，曰：「吾聞帝已崩，四日不發喪，欲誅諸將。

translations.chinese: 酈將軍往見審食其，曰：「吾聞帝已崩，四日不發喪，欲誅諸將。
translations.literal: General Li went to see Shen Yiji and said: "I have heard the Emperor has already died; for four days the death has not been announced because you wish to execute the various generals.
translations.idiomatic: General Li went to see Shen Yiji and said: 'I've heard the emperor has passed away. You've kept it secret for four days because you plan to execute the generals.'

context.previous: 人或聞之，語酈將軍。
context.next: 誠如此，天下危矣。

translations.chinese: 誠如此，天下危矣。
translations.literal: If this is true, all under Heaven is in danger.
translations.idiomatic: If this is true, the empire is in grave danger.'

context.previous: 酈將軍往見審食其，曰：「吾聞帝已崩，四日不發喪，欲誅諸將。
context.next: 陳平、灌嬰將十萬守滎陽，樊噲、周勃將二十萬定燕、代，此聞帝崩，諸將皆誅，必連兵還鄉以攻關中。

translations.chinese: 陳平、灌嬰將十萬守滎陽，樊噲、周勃將二十萬定燕、代，此聞帝崩，諸將皆誅，必連兵還鄉以攻關中。
translations.literal: Chen Ping and Guan Ying command a hundred thousand defending Yingyang; Fan Kuai and Zhou Bo command two hundred thousand settling Yan and Dai—if they hear the Emperor has died and all generals are to be executed, they will certainly unite their troops and return to their native regions to attack Guanzhong.
translations.idiomatic: Chen Ping and Guan Ying command 100,000 troops defending Yingyang; Fan Kuai and Zhou Bo lead 200,000 pacifying Yan and Dai. If they hear the emperor is dead and all generals are to be executed, they'll surely join forces and march home to attack Guanzhong.'

context.previous: 誠如此，天下危矣。
context.next: 大臣內叛，諸侯外反，亡可翹足而待也。」

translations.chinese: 大臣內叛，諸侯外反，亡可翹足而待也。」
translations.literal: Great ministers rebel internally, feudal lords rebel externally—destruction can be expected in the time it takes to raise a foot."
translations.idiomatic: The ministers will revolt from within, the lords from without. Disaster will follow in the blink of an eye.''

context.previous: 陳平、灌嬰將十萬守滎陽，樊噲、周勃將二十萬定燕、代，此聞帝崩，諸將皆誅，必連兵還鄉以攻關中。
context.next: 審食其入言之，乃以丁未發喪，大赦天下。

translations.chinese: 審食其入言之，乃以丁未發喪，大赦天下。
translations.literal: Shen Yiji went in and spoke; they then announced the death on the dingwei day and granted a great amnesty to all under Heaven.
translations.idiomatic: Shen Yiji went in and reported this. On the dingwei day they announced the emperor's death and granted a general amnesty throughout the realm.

context.previous: 大臣內叛，諸侯外反，亡可翹足而待也。」

translations.chinese: 盧綰聞高祖崩，遂亡入匈奴。
translations.literal: Lu Wan heard Gao Zu had died and then fled and entered the Xiongnu.
translations.idiomatic: When Lu Wan heard that Gaozu had died, he fled to the Xiongnu.

translations.chinese: 丙寅，葬。
translations.literal: On the bingyin day, they buried him.
translations.idiomatic: On the bingyin day, he was buried.

context.next: 己巳，立太子，至太上皇廟。

translations.chinese: 己巳，立太子，至太上皇廟。
translations.literal: On the jisi day, they installed the Crown Prince at the Grand Supreme Sovereign's temple.
translations.idiomatic: On the jisi day, the crown prince was installed as emperor at the temple of the Grand Supreme Sovereign.

context.previous: 丙寅，葬。
context.next: 群臣皆曰：「高祖起微細，撥亂世反之正，平定天下，為漢太祖，功最高。」

translations.chinese: 群臣皆曰：「高祖起微細，撥亂世反之正，平定天下，為漢太祖，功最高。」
translations.literal: The assembled ministers all said: "Gao Zu arose from humble and minor beginnings, overturned the chaotic age and returned it to rightness, pacified all under Heaven—he is the Grand Ancestor of Han with the highest achievements."
translations.idiomatic: All the ministers declared: 'Gaozu rose from obscurity, brought order to a chaotic era, and pacified the realm. He is the Grand Ancestor of Han, whose merits are unmatched.'

context.previous: 己巳，立太子，至太上皇廟。
context.next: 上尊號為高皇帝。

translations.chinese: 上尊號為高皇帝。
translations.literal: They presented the honored title of High Emperor.
translations.idiomatic: They honored him with the title of High Emperor.

context.previous: 群臣皆曰：「高祖起微細，撥亂世反之正，平定天下，為漢太祖，功最高。」
context.next: 太子襲號為皇帝，孝惠帝也。

translations.chinese: 太子襲號為皇帝，孝惠帝也。
translations.literal: The Crown Prince inherited the title as Emperor—this is Emperor Xiaohui.
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince succeeded to the imperial throne as Emperor Xiaohui.

context.previous: 上尊號為高皇帝。
context.next: 令郡國諸侯各立高祖廟，以歲時祠。

translations.chinese: 令郡國諸侯各立高祖廟，以歲時祠。
translations.literal: He ordered the commanderies, states, and feudal lords to each establish a temple to Gao Zu to make offerings at the proper seasonal times.
translations.idiomatic: He commanded all commanderies, states, and lords to establish temples to Gaozu for seasonal sacrifices.

context.previous: 太子襲號為皇帝，孝惠帝也。

translations.chinese: 及孝惠五年，思高祖之悲樂沛，以沛宮為高祖原廟。
translations.literal: When in the fifth year of Emperor Xiaohui they recalled Gao Zu's grief and joy at Pei, they made Pei Palace the original temple of Gao Zu.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year of Emperor Xiaohui's reign, they commemorated Gaozu's bittersweet memories of Pei by designating Pei Palace as his ancestral temple.

context.next: 高祖所教歌兒百二十人，皆令為吹樂，後有缺，輒補之。

translations.chinese: 高祖所教歌兒百二十人，皆令為吹樂，後有缺，輒補之。
translations.literal: The one hundred twenty boys Gao Zu had taught to sing were all ordered to perform music; when later there were vacancies, they would always fill them.
translations.idiomatic: The 120 boys Gaozu had taught to sing were all assigned to perform music; whenever openings occurred later, they were immediately filled.

context.previous: 及孝惠五年，思高祖之悲樂沛，以沛宮為高祖原廟。

translations.chinese: 高帝八男：長庶齊悼惠王肥；
translations.literal: The High Emperor had eight sons: the eldest, Concubine-born King Dao Hui of Qi, Fei;
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Gaozu had eight sons: his eldest, born of a concubine, was Fei, King Daohui of Qi;

context.next: 次孝惠，呂后子；

translations.chinese: 次孝惠，呂后子；
translations.literal: next Emperor Xiaohui, son of Empress Lü;
translations.idiomatic: next came Emperor Xiaohui, Empress Lü's son;

translations.chinese: 太史公曰：夏之政忠。
translations.literal: The Grand Historian says: The governance of Xia was loyal.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian remarks: The Xia dynasty's governance emphasized loyalty.

context.next: 忠之敝，小人以野，故殷人承之以敬。

translations.chinese: 忠之敝，小人以野，故殷人承之以敬。
translations.literal: When loyalty became corrupt, petty men became crude; therefore the Yin people succeeded it with reverence.
translations.idiomatic: But when loyalty decayed, small-minded people grew boorish; thus the Yin succeeded it with reverence.

context.previous: 太史公曰：夏之政忠。
context.next: 敬之敝，小人以鬼，故周人承之以文。

translations.chinese: 敬之敝，小人以鬼，故周人承之以文。
translations.literal: When reverence became corrupt, petty men became superstitious; therefore the Zhou people succeeded it with culture.
translations.idiomatic: When reverence decayed, small-minded people became obsessed with spirits; thus the Zhou succeeded it with ritual propriety.

context.previous: 忠之敝，小人以野，故殷人承之以敬。
context.next: 文之敝，小人以僿，故救僿莫若以忠。

translations.chinese: 文之敝，小人以僿，故救僿莫若以忠。
translations.literal: When culture becomes corrupt, petty men become deceitful; therefore to rescue deceit nothing is better than loyalty.
translations.idiomatic: When ritual propriety decays, small-minded people become deceitful; thus to cure deceit, nothing works better than loyalty.

context.previous: 敬之敝，小人以鬼，故周人承之以文。
context.next: 三王之道若循環，終而復始。

translations.chinese: 三王之道若循環，終而復始。
translations.literal: The Way of the Three Kings is like a cycle, ending and beginning again.
translations.idiomatic: The Way of the Three Kings moves in cycles, ending only to begin anew.

context.previous: 文之敝，小人以僿，故救僿莫若以忠。
context.next: 周秦之閒，可謂文敝矣。

translations.chinese: 周秦之閒，可謂文敝矣。
translations.literal: Between Zhou and Qin, it can be said culture had become corrupt.
translations.idiomatic: Between the Zhou and Qin dynasties, ritual had clearly decayed.

context.previous: 三王之道若循環，終而復始。
context.next: 秦政不改，反酷刑法，豈不繆乎？

translations.chinese: 秦政不改，反酷刑法，豈不繆乎？
translations.literal: Qin's governance did not reform but instead made laws and punishments harsh—was this not mistaken?
translations.idiomatic: Qin's rule refused to change, instead making laws and punishments ever harsher—was this not a grave error?

context.previous: 周秦之閒，可謂文敝矣。
context.next: 故漢興，承敝易變，使人不倦，得天統矣。

translations.chinese: 故漢興，承敝易變，使人不倦，得天統矣。
translations.literal: Therefore when Han arose, inheriting corruption and changing easily, it made people untiring and obtained Heaven's succession.
translations.idiomatic: Thus when Han rose to power, inheriting the corrupt ways but changing them readily, it energized the people and gained Heaven's mandate.

context.previous: 秦政不改，反酷刑法，豈不繆乎？
